description: Small little shop serving quality and taste! I appreciate that some flavors use dairy alternatives, such as coconut milk or almond milk. This is blessing to all those stricken with the unfortunate disease known as lactose intolerance. Compared to Yogurtland's version of the same flavor, the ones here had so much more depth and just tasted real. I would recommend if you want some dessert after a good meal on Irving Street. If it's available, give Grapefruit a try! It even had a slightly bitter aftertaste just like the fruit.
author: Amber T.

description:
I'll make this short and sweet. Before moving back from SoCal I was obsessed with froyo. Since moving back home, it has become quite a challenge finding decent froyo. I get it SF. It's cold all the time here and folks just don't crave it all the time. 

Well along comes easy breezy--prob the only froyo location in sunset. 

The good:
-Good selection of toppings. 
-Non dairy options available: ie cashew Milk and coconut milk items. 

The not so good:
-yikes! Price spike! $.88/ounce equate to paying $6 for a half full cup of yogurt with minimal toppings. ( those toppings are heavy. So watch out). 
-only one work per shift so they have to play cashier and staff offering samples = long wait time of busy. 
-limited flavors TBH. 
-their origins tart is not they creamy. Just. Preference of mine.
author: Diane T.

description: We ordered two yogurts - one large with two toppings($12.10), the other large with three($14.50). My three topping yogurt was supposed to be sour worms, gummy bears, and hot fudge.  There was no fudge on my yogurt, so can I have my $2.40 back?
author: Liz Z.

description:
Great spot for frozen yogurt with toppings by the ounce. Two rotating vegan options are available at all times. Each flavor gets two weeks before it is rotated out. Sometimes the flavors are fantastic (chocolate almond, cherry marzipan), sometimes they are not so great (turmeric citrus?) but it's just so nice to have options as a vegan. I'm thrilled this place is in my neighborhood, the Inner Sunset. A few vegan toppings are available too: fruit, Oreo pieces, toasted coconut, nuts.

The people who work here are super friendly. Between the atmosphere, the vegan soft serve yogurt, the toppings, and the convenience to my apartment, this just might be my favorite spot in the Inner Sunset.
author: Erin M.

description:
Selection is odd. Prices are extra-super-premium. 

We so need a Yogurtland and/or a Pinkberry in this neighborhood.
author: John P.

description:
Not enough variety of flavors ,
So many reviews but random flavors to pick from, not my cup of tea to have frozen yogurt
author: Ruby H.

description: We were looking for some dessert after grubbing on chicken wings at San Tung.  This place was a short walk down a few blocks from where we were.  The store was pretty simple with a number of different flavors to choose from including red velvet, vanilla custard, mint chocolate, a non-dairy mint mojito, and tart.  We were able to sample a bunch of flavors, but the staff needed to help us dispense the yogurt into the mini sample cups.  The staff member serving our samples, gave us some good insight into his favorites and the most popular combos.  I ended up getting a mix of the tart and the mint mojito.  The tart was solid.  Creamy with a good amount of that sour pucker you are looking for in such a flavor.  The mint mojito was very minty but not at all over powering.  I would definitely stop by this place again if in the area.
author: Mitch T.

description:
Easy Breezy has been in the Inner Sunset for several years, and the choices of flavors and toppings is great, plus you can pick and pile on whatever you like.

But recently, it's concerning how much they now charge for this.  It's currently at 88 cents per ounce, and as I filled a waffle cone about an inch over the top with no toppings, it cost a whopping $6.08 which included a surcharge for the city's mandatory health care.  It's a pretty stiff price to pay for just frozen yogurt in a cone.  The cone wasn't that big either, just a little larger than a standard sugar cone.
author: Aaron K.

description:
Love their frozen Custard!

If I could bathe in it, I would.

So creamy and rich, one forgets that desserts can be whopping in calories and increase glucose levels.  That being said, this little neighborhood joint maintains it's location because of the locals that frequent it.  There is enough room on the inside but if lacking, the cute red benches out front do a great job of inviting people to sit down and enjoy their desserts out of the daily hustle and bustle.

This is like your typical Froyo place, with signs above the dispensers labeled to let the consumer know if sugar was added or if it is a full cream/dairy dessert, etc.  I usually go with the original tart and the signature frozen custard.  On evil days, I top it off with the mochi pieces and the toffee bits.  But you can even have it plain and it is still very good.

They do take cards as well as cash..
author: Miika M.

description: Never mention this place to me again, it's 80+ cents per Oz of yogurt and it is full of sugary goodness. Probably never going here again because of how expensive it is, but it's worth going once for the instagram pic with the face of sugary evil incarnate. They have some of the greatest toppings, I'd go just to fill my cup up with waffle cones and brownie bites hehe.
author: Leo W.

description: Loved The option to have cashew milk , and almond milk-based fro yo. Pleasantly surprised by all the options for toppings and flavors.
author: Martinez D.

description: Tuesday was my first time coming here. I got a tart flavored yogurt (my favorite) and I noticed that when I went to the toppings they looked old. I decided to give the cheesecake a try and it tasted just... old and stale. Kind of a plastic taste to it. Bummer because the yogurt was actually very creamy and yummy.
author: Monica L.

description:
Conflicted.

I understand that it's expensive to rent retail spaces in San Francisco, but...to go from $0.58 per ounce to $0.79 per ounce...my cup of froyo, which included some weird tasting cheesecake bites, cost me $6.60. That's $2 more than the options at Honey Creme a few blocks down, which cost around $4.50 for a full cup and toppings (and I had walked by it earlier, danggit). I love Easy Breezy's full-fat french vanilla, but the price just does not seem justified. At least they still have their rewards card, and they're happy to combine stamps on one card. Still...to Honey Creme I go.
author: Adele F.

description: They have yummy flavors with different options for different people. They always have a vegan or dairy free flavor available and the flavors are labeled with how high the fat content is. Flavors come and go, so be sure to come back and see what's new. The only bad thing is that it's incredibly overpriced. It costs about twice as much as regular froyo.
author: Crystal R.

description:
My favorite frozen yogurt place by far! Although it's a little pricey, it's so worth it! And a majority of the froyo is nonfat, which is a bonus !! 

This time I got a Mini size: matcha, tart and vanilla. Topped off with waffle cookie, strawberries, cheesecake bites, chocolate covered marsh mellows and granola !
author: Shirley G.

description:
Best offering of froyo flavors including a range of creaminess to non dairy options... *infinite heart emojis*

The flavors will rotate but tend to be true to what it says it'll taste like and if available:
Mint mojito - !!!!!!!, Is all I have to say. 

Just be adventurous and try a multiple flavors or something new! You'll find your favorite here too! Unless of course, you don't like froyo.... then you're out of luck. I mean.. You can weigh in their toppings assortment?? Haha.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Fresh, yummy, and the perfect amount of sweetness. The toppings are neat and yummy whether it's from the fresh fruits or the crumby crunchy toppings. The space inside is a bit small but good enough to take to go. I give this place a 3 stars only for the reason being that I find it to be a bit pricey all for frozen yogurt. I guess if I were to be understanding, they would charge a bit more due to the ingredients they use?
I still recommend trying this place out.
author: Stacey M.

description:
I'm so glad they're open late on the weekends. Came here for a late night snack last Saturday night right around 10:30 and there was no one else there. 

It was my first time here, but I was very impressed with how healthy their yogurts sounded. It seemed like most of their flavors were either made with organic yogurt or were vegan with coconut or cashew milk. Their signs were very helpful so you know exactly what went into each flavor.

I don't know how often they switch out their flavors, but this was the selection on the night I went:
-mango lassi
-vanilla custard
-peanut butter (cashew milk)
-chocolate custard
-vanilla bean
-mint mojito (coconut milk)
-lemon ginger zinger
-original tart

I tried the mint mojito and original tart. To my surprise, the mint mojito tastes exactly like the drink and it was quite refreshing. I almost got that, but I fell in love with the original tart (it was just the right blend of sweet and tart) so I got some of that instead. The consistency of both flavors weren't as firm as I like in my froyo but it wasn't soft to the point of melting soon either.

They had a pretty big selection of toppings but I ended to just go with a plain bowl of froyo. 

Thought the prices here were a little bit pricey but I guess it makes sense given 1) that it's SF and 2) the high quality ingredients used to make the froyo.

There is limited seating inside but I would not recommend coming here with a big group if you're planning to eat and hang out here.
author: Dianna H.

description: Think I found my new fave froyo place! I love how they have low fat, med fat, and full fat options so you dont feel as guilty! I went for the vanilla bean, vanilla custard, chocolate custard, and strawberry topped with mochi, granola, and strawberries! They had some other unique flavors too like snicker doodle, mango lassi, and cheesecake! Soooo yummy and great quality too! Other places taste watered down and not as creamy. It was about $16 for me and my bf's froyo so a little pricey but worth it!
author: Alyssa C.

description: I don't know how this place has such high ratings. I've lived here for a month, and I have come to the conclusion that people in San Francisco love to be robbed. My cup of froyo came to $11 and change. The swirls of different flavors were good, but I'm not sure it was 11-dollars good.
author: Yu Z.

description:
Unseasonably warm weather means another review of something cold and refreshing!  Because, you know, that will keep me cool in this hot, stuffy house...

Although I'm around 9th Ave fairly often, I'd be lying if I said I was well aware of Easy Breezy all of this time.  And believe me, no one is more disappointed with myself than myself.  I mean, to think - all of those trips to the neighborhood (and all of that fighting for parking) and so many opportunities for froyo that I missed out on!  Sadness.

Like so many other froyo joints out there, Easy Breezy allows you to fill your cup with whatever combination you like of their offered flavors and finish it off with their array of toppings to pick from.  While the containers and trays of toppings are largely typical (sprinkles, nuts, bits of candy, mochi, fruits, syrups, etc.), the quality of their froyo is what makes them stand out.  Only about eight types are available on any given day, but they go beyond that, offering each with varying fat contents (non, low, medium, high, and full).

During my two visits, I've mostly stuck with the same toppings (I'm boring like that), but I've tried a handful of their flavors:

-- Pistachio, Vanilla Bean, and Vanilla Custard with Peanuts, Almonds, and Strawberries: (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/easy-breezy-frozen-yogurt-san-francisco-2?select=qnIDAJJ7EkdsxBtWhu1Eng)
-- Chocolate Custard and Coffee Custard with Mochi, Peanuts, Almonds, and Strawberries: (https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/easy-breezy-frozen-yogurt-san-francisco-2?select=TZyAYbulEiEXpS2Nv7f9sA)

The Almonds, Peanuts, and Strawberries were fine (hard to screw them up), but the Mochi was great - just the right gumminess and not overly sweet.  Of the five flavors I tried, the custards were the best for the most part (I thought the coffee one tasted a little off).  Not so coincidentally, the three also had the highest fat content (full fat), but they were the most flavorful and the creamiest.  The pistachio (organic, low fat) was pretty solid as well, but the vanilla bean (non-fat) was disappointing (thin, milky texture, almost tasteless).

As tasty as their stuff may be though, at $0.75 per ounce, Easy Breezy feels a little pricey compared to other froyo places I've been to.  However, there's no questioning the quality you get.  Plus, they have stamp cards, so they do offer some value back.  In any case, forego the few tables they have inside and take advantage of the benches out front.  Perfect for those warm, SF nights, but pretty nice when it's not so warm as well, especially when you're on a date!  Get cozy... ;)
author: Mike L.

description:
So long Tutti Fruitti. Is there a place in contemporary society for a neighborhood stationery store full of novelty odds and ends? The former knick knack shop added a lot of character, but frozen yogurt just sounds more appealing, especially with the anthropomorphic cup of yogurt holding a spoon.
The yogurt here is creamy, smooth, and refreshing. You know the drill, sample or don't sample, self-serve, add or don't add toppings, and pay by the ounce. I tried the Vanilla Custard and it was sweet and creamier than frozen yogurt since it is 'full-fat.' 
There is a nice selection of flavors given the small space. Non-fat, medium-fat, full-fat, organic, non-dairy, etc. However, it is on the pricey side compared to the most froyo places.
author: Joy W.

description:
I loooooooove easy breezy. Most of the time in sf I feel like all these small shops are all fluff, fads, hipster, but absolutely no substance... finally, easy breezy is not one of those and is awesome!! They have a ucsf student discount (10%?.. not sure but I use it to knock a few cents off each time) and a punch card.. which I fill up super quickly. 

Service: usually great and cheery! The only time I had a weird experience was last night when the guy clearly didn't wanna be at work 4/5

Froyo: ahhhh-mazinggg. They are also super accommodating for people with dairy allergy (or vegan) and have many tasty non-dairy options. I finally found a place with rotating flavors that are actually good and not just gimmicks like so many ice cream places in sf. As for regular flavors, I love vanilla custard. If you've never tried custard froyo, get it! Favorite non-dairy flavor so far was the berry flavor on rotation now. My favorite flavor of all time was coffee custard. I got it 3 times that week and it hasn't been back since ;(. Toppings are always kept nice and clean and fresh. Love this place! 5/5
author: Anna N.

description:
Second time here.  It's the only dessert place within walking distance from the restaurant we ate at so we decided to come here.  Perks are that kids get a free tattoo! 

I prefer them to separate the "nuts" (peanuts, walnuts, etc) away from the fruit bar.  The nuts should be covered with a lid for those who are allergic since we have an allergic child to nuts.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I like, I like, I like very much! 
I first heard about this place when it opened up in the Castro across the street from my BFFs place. I have an ice cream Sunday ritual and it was love at first sight. Then love at first bite! The feature flavor back then was Thai ice tea and it was phenomenal. I learned they make their own flavors unlike most fro yo places that just dump Pre fab mixes into their machines from a plastic bag that comes from who knows where. I recently found this location (by my BFF's NEW house) and was surprised to learn it's been around longer than the Castro location. On the hottest day on record in San Francisco (102° in the Sunset at 5PM?!) their featured flavor was lemon basil and it was so refreshing and wonderful I can't wait to go back.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
Usually I like coffee or coconut anything.

Easy breezy proved me wrong.

Their Vietnamese coffee and coconut flavor tasted like lip balm.

Waxy. Bland. And left a weird film in my mouth that I'm still trying to wash down with water.

Their chocolate custard was okay though.

Really want to give this place two stars, but I'll be nice.....they are very expensive.

71 cents an ounce adds up quick!

My 71 cents worth of advice is to skip this place and find another dessert place.

2.5 rounded to 3 stars to avoid all the extra hate mail I've been getting lately from people hating my negative reviews.
author: Jack R.

description: There don't seem to be many froyo spots in San Francisco but at least this place is quality. When I went they had milky tea froyo, chocolate and vanilla custard, vegan chocolate, Oreo fudge brownie, original tart, vanilla bean and basil lime sorbet. It was kinda annoying how they don't give you sample cups to sample yourself. Instead, you have to ask the workers to give you tastes of specific flavors. Luckily, the guy who worked there was really nice and gave me samples of all of them-and all of them were very good, especially the less healthy, higher fat options (obviously). They specify which flavors are fat free, low fat, medium fat, and full fat but unfortunately didn't have any sugar free options. The toppings were good-they had a bunch of chocolates, brownie and cheesecake bites, cookie dough (which I recommend getting), locally made granola, sprinkles, toasted coconut, mochi, Oreo crumbs, and many more sauces than most froyo spots including fruity sauces, marshmallow creme, peanut butter sauce, caramel and chocolate sauces (with sugar free options) and even Chile powder! The only thing I was disappointed about was the lack of fruit-they only had strawberries and blueberries-which were at least fresh. Overall, I would return-especially since I now have a punch card!
author: Melissa G.

description: Shannon is the best! She let me try all the samples and was super patient. She gave me suggestions on which flavors mixed well together and taught me the process of making the yogurt.  And the yogurt was delicious, especially the milky tea.  Will definitely be coming back again!  Thank you Shannon!
author: Vincen W.

description:
Delicious, high quality frozen yogurt. It's pretty pricey at ~$0.75 an ounce but it's a nice treat to have. I got a fairly small cup of yogurt and it came out to $5.50. The service here is friendly and offered to give free samples. There's also not too much seating inside.

I really enjoyed the thai tea flavor which was unique and the vanilla custard which was super creamy and rich. There's a wide variety of decadent toppings I only wish they had more fruit options.
author: Linda X.

description:
Easy Breezy is an easy way to satiate your sweet cravings whether you're vegan, or looking for a lower sugar alternative.

Easy Breezy always has a non dairy option, their frozen yogurt is made with love and organic ingredients, and their staff are always on hand to assist with providing samples of their flavors. 

If you're going to indulge - indulge right. 

With an impressive array of toppings, one of which includes a delicious locally made cookie dough, and a variety of flavors - Easy Breezy makes manifesting a frozen dessert -both delicious and interactive - as far as desserts go. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Have come back a few more times and the toppings selection has gotten better as have the flavors. Tonight, I had the chocolate, Thai iced tea, and snicker doodle and loved every bite. 

Sidebar: any place that has Capt'n Crunch AND kit kat as toppings gets extra points from me :)
author: Semuteh F.

description: Great fresh tasting yogurt but not worth the the price my cup of yogurt cost me $13 and it comes out pretty melted to begin with im sure if i waited a few  minutes later it would be liquid.
author: Harpreet M.

description:
I think this place is supposed to have elevated froyo, but it's only as good as every other froyo I've had but at 2-2.5x the price ($0.81/oz is a lot and really adds up when you include fruit toppings).

Maybe I'm just missing the genes for a sophisticated froyo palate, but I don't see why their yogurt warrants the price. That being said, still giving them 3 stars because I still happily devoured my cup in 3 mins despite the serious Sunset chill.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Such a quality froyo. It's just as creamy as ice cream!

Just tried the chai flavor today. It's so delicious, I almost didn't need any toppings.
author: Novalina N.

description:
Easy Breezy Lemon Squeezy. This is by far the most adorable yogurt store I have ever been in. I wouldn't call myself a manly man, but the name and the super cute smiley-face yogurt cup mascot gets me every time. Although the price is pretty steep compared to other stores (~75cents/oz), both the quality and taste of the yogurts are second to none. 

Since I am lactose intolerant, I do enjoy how they often have 2-3 non-dairy options using almond milk or coconut milk as a substitute. But they have quite exotic flavors as well, for the average consumer; ranging from vietnamese coffee to oaxaca chili chocolate. Non-dairy flavors I have tried in the past have been the blueberry & beyond, moscow mule, and peanut butter. I will warn you the dispensor is super quick, so if you only want a little, just pull it down for a second or else your cup will magically be fuller than you want. But is that really a bad problem?

Seats are limited, so just be wary when you are in line. And don't be shy to ask the workers if you are looking to try a sample, since they are they ones that dispense the yogurt in the sample cups for you.

Definitely a place to check out for some high-quality and unique flavor yogurt!
author: Alan N.

description:
Went to Easy Breezy with a friend who had been there before and said it was definitely worth the extremely fully belly after a delicious Thai meal up the street. I got the Original Tart and Birthday Cake flavors (I'm a sucker for anything birthday cake flavor), and topped it with sprinkles, hot fudge, peanuts and strawberries. Oh goodness. This was delicious. Neither flavor was cloyingly sweet and it had just the right hint of a custard consistency/taste. It did seem a tad pricey like others have mentioned, but like I said, I don't get dessert very often so for me it was kind of a splurge and I had an idea of what I was getting into.

The place was clean and bright, and for it being on a Saturday night during Warriors playoffs, service was fast and efficient. I am not a big dairy dessert person, but this hit the spot.
author: Jada B.

description: Was thinking this place would be better. I didn't know that all of the yogurt wasn't made with milk. They were all made with yogurt or cream &egg, or coconut milk, or cashew milk. I ended up getting chocolate custard, vanilla custard, and original tart. My favorite by far was the original tart. Super yummy. The custards melted super quick. Two small fro yos ended up being 17$ so beware that it's pretty pricey! Would go back when there's a flavor I really like (coconut, banana) :)
author: Hayley D.

description:
Really good! Friendly staff. He let us try as many flavors as we wanted and had good recommendations. Not a huge selection like some yogurt spots, which I like. They have really good custard. The turmeric starburst was yum!! Great for a hot day or to fulfill a sweet tooth. 10% discount if you work at UCSF! (Side note: Jamba Juice only offers 5%). 

The sauces (chocolate, fudge, etc) are free! 

They take credit card with no charge/minimum!
author: Ayda C.

description: I need to stop coming here.  It's way too easy to get stuck with a $8 single small cup of frozen yogurt.  There is much more value for your money at a number of other places in SF.  They charge by the ounce.  They have 2 sizes of cups.  A 3/4 filled small cup with the toppings costs over $8.  It tastes great, but not worth it.  I can only imagine the cost of you grab the large cup.
author: Rob S.

description: I am so conflicted. The frozen yogurt is fine. I got vanilla bean. Wanted the custard but it's full fat so had to stop,  though the sample tasted amazing. I have this thing.  I buy plain vanilla yogurt and take it home to mix with natural peanut butter. It's one of my favorite things. I thought I'd get a tub of the vanilla and started filling up. We get to the counter and my husband said, "That's $22 worth of yogurt". I looked at the sales girl and asked how that's possible. She told me many people are surprised at the prices. She said it's 81cents an oz. I had no idea. I didn't know what to do. I had this melting tub in front of me and don't know why I didn't say I simply can't pay that outrageous price.  We paid and I walked out shell shocked. I was kicking myself but never again. Those are some criminal prices. Things that cost less per oz than this frozen yogurt : any of the homemade ice creams from SF ice cream shops filled with yummy surprises, pie, ramen, an amazing bowl of pho, lamb chops, Dungeness crab. I think you get what I'm giving you. Just not worth it. I feel robbed and dirty right now.
author: Suzanna G.

description: So, mixed review.  Very friendly service, delicious chocolate custard and cookies and cream, also delicious "non-dairy" mango go-go (which didn't feel non-dairy to the lactaid intolerant member of our group). Lots of toppings but no fruit, which was disappointing. Limited flavors, and finally very pricey!  Most of our group would not go back.
author: Karne N.

description:
We came here during the Labor Day heatwave of 2017 at around 9:00pm because it was still 90 degrees in our apartment. We've never been but the set up inside is much like other frozen yogurt places-- you can fill your cup up with however much froyo and toppings you want and then pay by the ounce when you're done. We liked the actual flavors though they were pretty familiar -- hella Nutella, vanilla custard, strawberry custard, etc., and they had a dairy free birthday cake flavor that was surprisingly great. They have the option to swirl certain flavor pairs which was pretty cool. 

Even though we tried not overload our cup, we did and (literally) paid the price for it. If we were to go back, we'd maybe pick the smaller cup option and share it between two people. The cheapskates in us would also maybe just bring a baggie of toppings (nuts, fruit, and chocolate are all things we have a large supply of at home) and dump it on our bowls once we paid for the yogurt. Not as fun, but $15 for two cups frozen yogurt is hard to swallow. 

The inner sunset sweet treat rankings have now been updated as follows: 

1. Hometown creamery
2. Let's Roll
3. Holy Gelato
4. Easy Breezy 
5. Honey Creme

Now, we just have to get ourselves to Twirl &Dip before the heatwave ends...
author: T K.

description: Although the frozen yogurt is good, I don't like how expensive it is. Frozen yogurt should not be expensive. Barely got anything on ours and it came to $ 11-13 dollars for 2. Everywhere else is a third of what you pay here. I also don't like how they don't give you sample cups and do it themselves. I found that rather odd and stingy.
author: Mark Q.

description:
My favorite fro-yo place ever! Better than nube, yogurtland, and pinkberry. I'm soo addicted to this place and especially to the "full-fat" vanilla custard flavor. I can't help but to get it every single time! Top it off with mochi and strawberries, and I'm good.

The yogurt here is advertised as local and organic. Although I love the full fat vanilla custard, they also have nonfat, medium fat, and low fat flavors as well. The flavors switch up from time to time. I've seen green tea, chai, pumpkin, and Vietnamese coffee previously. Vanilla bean and tart seem to be consistent. 

There is a frequent buyer stamp card that you can use, and they also give out cute temporary tattoos at the counter.
author: Corinna T.

description:
My bf & I were thoroughly disappointed by this place :( 

Let me start with the good - they offer some unique flavors (mint mojito, coffee toffee!) and a variety of nonfat, low-fat, full-fat, and non-dairy options. And of course, they have original tart (which is my personal favorite). 

BUTTT the flavors were hit/miss and the consistency was a bit off. Some were also too watery! And at 71cents/oz (aka almost double the price of Yogurtland!!), I just didn't think it was worth it. 

Also, there were flies hovering over the uncovered toppings bar. We tried telling the employees, but they did not seem bothered by the flies, did not apologize for the unsanitary-ness, and worse of all, did not try to do anything to shoo away the flies!
author: Samantha C.

description:
Easy Breezy is easily my new froyo spot in San Francisco. Actually, scratch that. Favorite froyo spot ever! Sure, the prices are a tad steep but you get what you payfor in quality.

As usual, I went for the original tart but I decided to spice things up a little this time and mixed in a small swirl of custard. Four words. Party-in-my-mouth. Seriously! The sign said "full fat worth it", and it sure is! I topped it off with yogurt chips, mochi, almonds, mangoes, strawberries and cheesecake bites. The cheesecake bites were so delicious and fresh. I only wish that I took more. No problem, I'll just go back tomorrow for more.
author: Tiffany U.

description: Sf gets really cold but that doesn't stop me from craving this yumminess! little pricey but worth every penny. Their toppings are endless and flavors are pretty unique. Oh and their warm chocolate syrup is to die for:) it's so good i can eat it by itself lol #ChocolateIsLife
author: Louie B.

description:
Baby you summertime fine.

Feeling a mint mojito.. that isn't alcoholic, or in a coffee blend. But IN A FROYO INSTEAD!

Finally got to try this place out! They have the cutest little mascot standing outside their shop telling you what the flavor of the day is. And today was my lucky day, their flavor was mint mojito. 

The interior is a bit small but well-kept. The back wall contained the self-serve froyo machines and their cutely designed cups. In the middle of the shop contained all the toppings. What I really liked about this place is that it was so. Simple.

I love simplicity, and this place kept it sweet and simple. There was 8 flavors, including the flavor of the day. My default froyo for every place is usually strawberry, but since they didn't have it today I opted for vanilla bean to match with my mint mojito.

I love how unique the toppings are here. You don't see "chocolate turtles" or "potato chips" elsewhere. Sweet meets savory meets chocolatey meets fruity. So many endless possibilities from something quite simple.

Overall:
- A bit pricier than most froyo joints, but a lot of their stuff is actually organic so I can see why it's expensive.
- The mint mojito really tasted minty and citrusy, which I loves me a lot of. The vanilla bean gave it the creaminess that you'd usually find in froyo.
- Mochi was nice and chewy, and I like the colorful kinds.
- Blueberries were fresh, not too sweet and not too tart. Strawberries were refreshingly tart.
- WAFFLE COOKIE THINGY. IT WAS ADDICTING.
- Yogurt chips were crunchy and creamy sweet :}

They were playing swing music on Pandora, I laaaaaaaved it! Need I say more?

Location is nice, Irving has loads of neato places.

I need to stop adding so much toppings though heh. They accept cash and card!
author: Jerianne G.

description: First time here and it was amazing! The flavors, toppings, and customer service was absolutely great! I most definitely will be coming back!
author: Shaniah M.

description:
A bit overpriced probably its on irving street only worth it if you purchase the groupon deal which is $5 for $10 worth of yogurt.

The week I went to only had normal flavors & no special flavors. I was looking for the mint mojito & taro but sadly they didn't have it :( 

The ambience of the store is super cute & fresh! And the name store is catchy but been used already for maybelline.
author: Kathleen U.

description:
I'm no frozen yogurt connoisseur. I couldn't tell my Pinkberry from my Red Mango if my life depended on it, and if my life depended on it, I'd have to ask what kind of lactating Armageddon would we be headed toward to create those kind of sensibilities? It would be a world dominated by skinny young girls sampling all the flavors in those little paper cups before telling each other they're too fat to consider having any froyo. Not me and certainly not Jamie W. We just had pizza at Pasquale's a couple of doors down the street and just wanted something a bit refreshing to clean our tomato paste-saturated palates.

I had heard about Easy Breezy's Noe Valley spot but never tried it. so it was a happy circumstance to find this recently opened second shop open for business. I'm not a sampler. It's a waste time for me. I was immediately intrigued by the presence of a flavor called Oaxaca Chile, so I went for a cup and manhandled that spigot like nobody's business. I thought the non-fat Vanilla Bean would make a smooth contrast. I was right. A sprinkle of chopped toasted almonds and a couple of spoonfuls of fresh strawberries made it exactly the post-pizza creamy goodness we wanted to have (photo: http://bit.ly/1eg3FNm). Maybe I am a frozen yogurt connoisseur.

FROYO - 4 stars...a nice kick to the Oaxaca Chile that made the froyo more interesting than the standard variety
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...clean little shop with just a few seats
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...friendly servers
TOTAL - 4 stars..."they're Easy Breezy, and I'm Japanesey"...not my line, Utada sang it...finally an excuse to type it somewhere
author: Ed U.

description:
Inner Sunset has been needing a nice self-serve froyo place like a goldfish needs water. Hallelujah, our prayers have been answered with Easy Breezy!

The froyo itself is very good, albeit I can't tell that it's organic or local or gluten-free or whatever it is that's making the price so high. The original tart--which is always my go-to froyo flavor no matter where I go--is well-textured and truly tart. There are also other fun flavors, like banana cream pie and busta limes (ha). The machines work well and allow you to do a swirl of two flavors, if you so desire.

But what REALLY makes Easy Breezy standout is their full-fat frozen custard. Pictures really don't do it justice and neither will words, but I'll try: Imagine a flan or creme brûlée but in ice cream form and with more fat. Oohhhh yeeeaaaahhh. And you can even add toppings to your frozen custard too (more on this later) but the custard is so freaking good by itself, that added bonus almost becomes forgotten.

So the 5 stars I'm giving here really is for dat custard. But Easy Breezy didn't stop there and decided to make their toppings selection almost as equally impressive as their frozen treats. I'm very much used to Asian-run froyo places where the standard toppings are fruit, rainbow mochi, popping boba, gummies, etc. Well, Easy Breezy has all that (yes, even rainbow mochi and popping boba, which were pleasant surprises) and WAY more. There's caramel-filled chocolate turtles, peanut butter sauce, marshmallow sauce, bacon bits, potato chips, waffle pieces...the list goes on! My only complaint is that the toppings table juts awkwardly into the store's space and it can feel cramped even when there isn't a lot of people present. I wish there were a way to move that table so that it's against the wall perpendicular to the froyo machines.

Anyway, to summarize this sheaf, as a froyo place, Easy Breezy easily breezes past other similar self-served froyo chains (e.g., TuttiFrutti, Tuttimelon, Yoppi, etc). On the basis of just their froyo alone, I'd rank it at around the level of Pinkberry, Red Melon, and Yogen Fruz, but just slightly below Fraiche. But as a frozen dessert place, Dat Custard and those toppings really make this place something special and makes all non-Sunsetters even more jelly!
author: Tiffany H.

description: Love, love love it!! I avoid dairy for health reasons. They had a coconut milk option and a cashew milk. The cashew milk soft serve flavor was S'mores-yum!!!! Dark chocolate caramel drops for a topping. The help was very friendly and it's a cute place. Don't mind spending more for quality ingredients!
author: Gwen F.

description:
Their full-fat  yogurts... sounds frigtheningly fattening but they are most definitely liposomes encapsulating happiness.

At first I did not hold Easy Breezy in high regard, what with the cheesy name and storefront of baby blue and baby pink.  However it held my attention because people always suggest to come here for dessert.  I'm coming to appreciate this local business-type froyo parlor because we definitely do not need another froyo chain or boba store in the area, and it is now rapidly ascending the ranks for my go-to dessert place.  

Compared to Holy Gelato: despite not being holy and not being gelato, I like how Easy Breezy is  healthier (or so we think... until you become addicted to those full-fat flavors) and the price comes out to be quite a bit cheaper (unless you're one of those people who gets a mountain of yogurt and then a mountain of toppings).  It's by weight so your portion is not quantized--kind of annoying for the odd amounts of change if you pay in cash, but it's great that it's flexible and completely customizable.  It's a little bit more expensive than Yogurtland, which is why I would suggest getting mainly their specialty yogurt and minimal fruit/other heavy stuff.  Just a simple sprinkle of nuts adds a nice crunch; top it with the caramelized vanilla wafer and it's as good as a true SF-worthy dessert.

The ambiance is a small cute store with the cheesy but cute giant happy cup of yogurt, which I always amusingly imagine to be eating itself.  There are a few benches for the seating area and it's generally clean, though the dirty mirror bothers me a lot because we wanted to use it to take a picture and noticed how gross it is.  The soft-serve area is quaint, with flavors written in a classic black chalkboard and a layout that is overall reminiscent of Mario Party.

You can get flavor samples, but everything I've tried tastes exactly as you imagine.  They are named quite well and also categorized by fattiness (non-fat, low-fat, medium, full fat--it goes without saying, the fattier the tastier).  They also combine machines so you can get swirls!  The vanilla and Vietnamese coffee are great together, but unfortunately the Vietnamese coffee is decaf.  The full-fat custard and chocolate custard are like those delicious soft-serves at Souplantation/Sweet Tomatoes.  The salted caramel dog (or whatever it's called... not sure why there's the word dog in there) is not very salted and closer to a caramel frappucino but still good.  That's everything I've tried so far, but expect to see updates... many many updates.  Gotta try 'em all!

Lastly, they have stamp cards!  Yet another marking of a go-to P:
author: Edna C.

description:
NEW FRO-YO PLACE IN INNER SUNSET!! This place is super cute. It definitely caught my eye, even before they opened. Even though sunset is known for it's cold (foggy) nights, people will still come out for some yummy healthy fro-yo!

AMBIANCE
-Look and feel is, well, so easy breezy ;)
-Wooden floors and walls, cool blue and white colors, little chalkboards displaying fro-yo flavors, lots of colorful toppings, cute fro-yo mascot/logo.
-Small seating area, some benches outside too

FROYO
-I always go for the tart flavors. I tried regular tart and grapefruit tart! 
-Lots of toppings - cut fresh fruit, candy bar pieces, and your staple "popping boba," and mochi. 
-Price is ~50cents an ounce, not the cheapest but there aren't too many other froyo places around here so I'll live. 

Perfect place to stop by after dinner or a savory meal :) I shall be back!
author: Grace J.

description: Frozen yogurt is a weekly stop for me all over the city... But $8.95 for their smallest 12oz cup is absolutely ridiculous. The flavor selection is good and the staff is excellent. But the price is steep by any standards. I don't Yelp often or ever for that matter, but I felt I had to share my feeling of being brazenly ripped off today.
author: Oliver O.

description:
This place just opened up in the great neighborhood of the inner sunset. Wonderful new addition to the 9th ave strip! 

I have waited a long time for a frozen yogurt shoppe to open up on 9th. I even pondered about opening up my own. But my husband is afraid that I will eat the profits. I am a frozen yogurt addict and the first step is picking up the spoon. Second is putting it in my mouth!!

One downside. This place is the priciest of them all. At 61cents an ounce it's a wallet burst.
author: Michelle I.

description:
Pros: The staff is friendly and offers to give samples without being prompted! The hours of the store are great for a bit later hang outs. There is a pretty good selection of yogurt flavors and toppings. I also like their cute cartoon logo.

Cons: I just wasn't really feeling the texture of the yogurt. It wasn't rich or thick enough... kind of like a thin, watered down version of pinkberry or yogurtland. Their best flavor is probably the original tart (which is my usual go-to flavor).

Overall: For all the variety of yogurt places out there, I would probably skip this place if you are looking for good yogurt. It definitely doesn't taste terrible... it is just a bit lackluster in my opinion.
author: Timothy Y.

description:
Love this place!!!  They have traditional yogurt as well as use nut milks and custards and custom blend in all local organic ingredients daily.  My favorite is the citrus hibiscus or the salty dog caramel if I'm feeling really like spoiling myself.  And I just wish I lived closer so I could enjoy them more often!  My 
kids love it too and since my daughter loves custard this is the only place you can please the whole family.
author: Jim U.

description:
One of my favorite froyo spots!

They have the best flavors and good toppings to choose from. The place is really cute and clean. 

On my recent visit, I mixed French vanilla custard with chocolate custard and added rainbow mochi and cheesecake bites for my toppings. My favorite mix thus far!

Friendly service, slightly higher prices. My froyo usually comes out to $4-5 for a cup that isn't filled to the brim and that's when I don't pile on the toppings.
author: Fallon P.

description: Love the decor!  Looks like the out side of a house with a roof indoors.  Very fun atmosphere fun staff and of course good frozen yogurt.  Their non dairy flavor is made with cashew milk and that is the ONLY good non dairy frozen desert that is actually creamy.  Great job!!!!
author: Michael H.

description:
If you think this is your typical froyo spot, man are you mistaken!  This isn't a place where you can walk in and go crazy sampling froyo on your own. No siree! Instead, you have to wait for one of the workers to get the samples for you.  Maybe the reason they have someone getting samples for you is because it is so damn expensive. $0.71/oz! (almost twice the price of other fro-yo places) Holy shyzaaa! 

Flavors: 
But I think their unique flavors definitely make up for the price. I thought it was pretty hilarious that under the flavors, it's labeled either "low-fat" (w/cashew or coconut milk) or "FULL-fat" (w/ eggs & cream).  Today's flavor of the day was HORCHATA! I really enjoyed it when I sampled it. But course I opted for the "FULL-FAT" w/ the chocolate custard, vanilla custard, and viet coffee. Such creamy goodness! (hence the cream I suppose) I would recommend! The other low-fat flavors today were coconut and lemon hibiscus.   

Toppings:
The toppings were also very eclectic, including horchata dough (say what???), coffee granola, passionfruit popping boba, chocolate covered marshmallows, and "very dark chocolate" brownies, only to name a few. I would have liked more fruit as toppings, however. I think they offered only two kinds of fruit.  But overall, I've definitely never come across such a variety of toppings before.  Of course they also have your usual toppings as well: mochi, cheesecake, heath pieces, gummy bears, m&ms, yogurt chips, etc.

I didn't use it but i thought it was a nice touch that this place offers dividers you can place in your cups so that your froyo flavors aren't mixed together.
author: Janel L.

description:
Dear God, this froyo was expensive.  When I lived in Pittsburgh, I got froyo for 41 cents per oz.  This was over twice that much.  I can't even remember how much, but it was exorbitant, to the point where my (admittedly very large) bowl was.. oh crap, I can't remember how much it cost.  Somewhere between $11-14.  That is ridiculous.  Completely ridiculous.

I'd been craving frozen yogurt for months, especially the pick your own toppings variety, so in that sense, Easy Breezy was just what I wanted.  I loaded up a big bowl to share with my husband.  The vanilla bean flavor was delicious (though the texture seemed quite a lot icier than I'm used to - less creamy more icy.  Unknown as to why.  Deducting star for texture), and they had a decent toppings range. Could've used more fruit.  But I went to town with sprinkles, kiwi fruit, strawberries, m+ms, and various other things of the peanut butter and chocolate persuasion.  It was overkill, but they don't have froyo where I live and I'm experiencing withdrawal.  I had to binge.

Serious sticker shock at the register.  Too bad I couldn't actually remove toppings or shove the frozen yogurt back in the machine at that point.  Honestly it's a joke.  Every time I think, "Gee, living in California would be nice!" I eat a $12 bowl of frozen yogurt and I'm like "Nope."  Well, it was pretty good at least, and it satisfied the craving.  But apply toppings carefully or face a high price!
author: Meredith A.

description:
3.5 stars.

Heads up: yogurt is $0.68/oz. I didn't see the price anywhere in the restaurant, so that came as a shocker, considering most froyo places are around $0.30/oz+.

Easy Breezy is cute. They have good flavors with a variety of types (custard, low fat yogurt, nonfat yogurt) and interesting toppings.

Some flavors:
- Vanilla custard (full fat)
- Chocolate custard (full fat)
- Vietnamese Coffee (nonfat)
- Oaxaca Chili Chocolate (spicy! my favorite!)
- Vanilla Bean (nonfat yogurt)
- Regular tart froyo
- Key Lime Pie froyo

Some of the interesting toppings:
- Mochi
- Egg-less cookie dough
- Tcho chocolate
- Premium granola

The froyos were a little on the icy side and slightly too soft/melty. The custards are really good, but limited in flavors. Overall, good dessert option in the neighborhood. Just watch how much you get, or you might be in for a $10 surprise.

They have buy 10, get 1 free punch cards.
author: Alice T.

description:
Easy Breezy always has some staple, regular flavors like vanilla, chocolate, tart, etc, but also rotates through some really interesting flavors as well! Last time I went, I tried out their kettle corn flavored frozen yogurt- it sounds so weird but it actually works! It tastes exactly how you'd imagine. 

Also they have just the marshmallows from lucky charms as a topping!!! Can't beat that! :P
author: Stephany L.

description:
Easy Breezy beautiful cover girl~ 

Wait, no. Just kidding. It's yogurt. It's beautiful, beautiful yogurt. It's beautiful yogurt that comes in different flavors and different levels of fat from nonfat to low fat to full of worth it fat (according to them, not me). 

Parking is all on the street so good luck with that. 

Irving St. has a lot of shops and restaurants, but Easy Breezy still stands out with their cute yogurt mascot and lively pop music playing outside. The inside is a bit small and if the place gets crowded then it could be a pain to maneuver in, but the yogurt is just delicious. They keep benches outside for people to sit on and enjoy their yogurt and inside also has a few small tables and chairs for you to sit at. And they even have a bathroom inside here! And it was really clean and didn't smell bad so yay.

Yogurt and toppings are all self serve and they have sample cups, too. I had gotten their vanilla bean yogurt (nonfat!) with a waffle cookie, mochi, sour worm, and the marshmallows from Lucky Charms. YES. They actually have just the marshmallows from Lucky Charms for a topping choice! How awesome is that? with vanilla bean, it was amazing. 

Service was friendly. It was just one girl working and she was quick with everything and even gave us a stamp card. 

Note: Pick up a stamp card! For every 4 oz. you buy, you get 1 stamp and 10 stamps get you a 10 oz. yogurt.
author: Venus L.

description:
Wonderful little yogurt joint. Such friendly service and BF said he had the best peanut butter yogurt of his life here! This is high praise coming from a frequent (and I mean FREQUENT) ice cream/yogurt/gelato eater. 

:)
author: Yanni L.

description:
I walked by Easy Breezy a couple of times.. My bad! I finally went in, and filled up a cup.
The girl working there is super friendly, and let us try almost all the flavors!
I picked the vanilla custard and chocolate flavors, but the carrot cake, vanilla bean (low fat) and peanutbutter were great too!

They have a good amount of toppings. Not much fresh fruit, but I like my froyo better with M&M's, Oreo pieces or (and!) salted caramel pieces... Hmmmm!! 

With $0.75 per ounce I find it a bit pricey.. But hey, we're talking about San Francisco.
author: Bibi O.

description:
REALLLY cute yogurt place with 6-7 featured flavors. Came here twice and had the peanut butter  yogurt which was good and the mango lassi which was delish and exactly like the Indian drink that is super creamy. 

I wish their toppings selection was more extensive but this is one of the first places that had waffle cone pieces really early on!
author: Angela H.

description:
A very unique frozen yogurt place. 

When you've been to one frozen yogurt establishment you've really been to them all, but this place is actually unique. What makes them stand apart are the flavors - not the standard fruit or chocolate variety but something altogether differ, at least for me. 

Toppings were the standard fare but the appeared fresh and in plentiful supply. The service was very friendly and chatty which added to a good overall experience.
author: José A.

description:
This is my favorite yogurt place.  Of all time.  My favorite flavor is the vanilla custard and yes, it is worth the full fat.  The custard is not just delicious on its own, but makes many other flavors SO MUCH BETTER.  Custard +chai, +Vietnamese coffee, +apple pie, +horchata, the list goes on and on.

Thing is, I love the custard so much that I've never gotten a tart flavor.  Probably also because Easy Breezy is also like a dessert-stop after a meal.  If I'm gonna have dessert, it better be creamy, fatty, and actually feel like a dessert.

Yes, it's pricey.  It's also not made from powdered mix like Yogurtland.  It's made in-house using local ingredients.  And since I never get tart, I never get fruit toppings.  But then again, I'm somewhat of a froyo purist and I hardly ever get toppings in general.  I had a lady in front of me complain her two towering tubs of froyo were too expensive (~$25), but that's kind of what happens when you use the topping bar as if it's a buffet bar.
author: Amy Y.

description: When you have the urge for a treat but don't want to jeopardize your waistline, Easy Breezy is the place to head to if you're in the Castro District of San Francisco.  A quaint and inviting shop that has yogurt flavors of your choosing with toppings of your choice.  Friendly service and always answering your questions if any. But I do remind that be careful on what you fill into you cup of choice and toppings..... What goes in is determined by the weight so be choosy on what you select because the final price does add up towards the end
author: Jake M.

description:
Love it!
a variety of yogurt types and flavors, amazing topping options and sauces. 
Self serve and very friendly staff.
author: Dror M.

description: Whenever we are in San Francisco, we love stopping by and getting the frozen yogurt. We always share the vanilla.
author: Dorothy B.

description:
Easy Breezy is a great name for this fro-yo shop, but I think they could change the tagline to "Really Great Mochi, Too". 

Yes, it is very easy to walk on in and help yourself to some soft serve. It's a small shop but they do a good job offering lots of different toppings, including the aforementioned mochi. Normally I don't get mochi, but was feeling extra adventurous on this particular evening. So glad I got a little wild! 

Yes, it's breezy. This neighborhood gets cold once the sun goes down. It doesn't stop me from enjoying a frozen dessert since I always pack a light jacket. It's the San Francisco way!

Kudos for the coconut as well as the coconut gunger flavored frozen yogurt. I love lemon anything and the ginger flavor wasn't overpowering. A few scoops will clean your palate without making you feel too full or on dairy overload. Add some of that pastel mochi and it's a winner!
author: Abby S.

description:
Our favs:
Banana Creme Pie
Strawberry breeze

They have a variety of toppings and warm sauces including tabasco. Garrett's Granola is my favorite and goes well with almost all flavors.

Grab a rewards cards. You will be back for more. 

They fill sample cups if u want to try before you buy.
author: Teresa S.

description: This place has some of the best vegan fro yo. Each week the have a different coconut or nut based yogurt. For someone who is dairy free, it's amazing!!! My daughter loves the strawberry coconut flavor. It's a bit more expensive but you can tell they have quality ingredients.
author: Jean Y.

description: Great quality yogurt, but a bit pricey for my taste (~55 cents/oz). Despite the price, I'm still a fan because the toppings are always well-stocked & fresh. They also give a 10% discount for working at UCSF so don't forget to bring your badge. Also, if you don't eat in, there's no tax added to your total. I had the strawberry breeze and chocolate milk with caramel sea turtles & mochi. Sooo good! I would highly recommend it =) Their mochi was chewy but moist. I loved the caramel sea turtles!!! Perfect way to end a meal. If you haven't tried it, you should at least once for samples. lol. I will definitely be back!!!
author: Brittany D.

description:
Better than Yogurtland.

Easy Breezy doesn't have as many flavors as Yogurtland, but the taste of each flavor is definitely superior. Don't be shy to ask the lady for some samples, she pours them for you but you can definitely try a few flavors before making your final decision. 

I had the vanilla, Vietnamese coffee, and pistachio flavors and they were all delicious! Vanilla was perfect and not too sweet, coffee was a punch of flavor, and pistachio really tasted like ground up pistachios!! No artificial crap flavors here. The toppings bar was awesome; very clean and orderly and the fruit was fresh. I piled on some plump, juicy looking raspberries and they were delicious. I'd definitely come back here, too bad it's not close to my apartment!
author: Sam F.

description:
This is how froyo is supposed to be!

Yes, it's on the pricier side compared to other places like Yogurtland. But you get what you pay for, the quality is top notch- for once my froyo is not half melted by the time I sit down to eat it. 

Some of their frozen yogurt flavors are dairy free, so pay attention to the Ingredients if you are particular with the texture.

Chocolate + coffee + hot fudge + almonds + mochi = bomb dot com
author: Carmen A.

description:
This placed used to be a toy store that never really sold any toys. Easy Breezy is a hole in the wall froyo shop with some unique flavors. They label their froyos with how much cream they put into it. Pretty legit I suppose. 

I had their Chocolate Custard and Original tart flavors. Topped them with a few mochi bits, waffle cone crackers and a green apple gummy soldier. Froyo here is weighed by the amount of stuff you pile into it, can get a bit pricy if you pile it high with toppings. 

The only drawback was the ventilation in the store. By the time my froyo got off the weigh scale (and after I had paid), the bottom half of the cup was already a warm yogurt soup. No joke, I was starting to sweat a cup full myself. Holy shiet..

I think this place will stay awhile since its the only froyo shop around. :)
author: Jason C. J.

description: Okay the frozen custard is amazing! or of the only flavors that I always get here! But I hadn't been in a year and it was 0.97 cents per ounce. And there is not price tag around to tell you until you weigh it and see it on the scale. Both my sister and I ended up weighing it together and it was $17.  SO ESPENSIVIE! Froyo in la isn't even this expensive........ but we felt bad to just not have it after we've already made it and everything so we paid and ate every single drop of the froyo... gosh the the taste was amazing but it's just not worth it.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Easy Breezy is small, compact. toppings bar in the center. machinese in back. cashier to the left.

pricing: .58 cents froyo & toppings, 24 dry topping of candies (lego candy), nuts, cereals, the usal 16 wet toppings of fruits, jellies, crumbled cookies/dough, etc.

froyo availability:
-coconut cream pie
-bananae
-grapefruit
-vanilla bean
-vanilla custard
-tart
-milk chocolate
-pistachio

frodrips:
-taylor dispening machine, karat customized cups
-texture non-dairy? tasted of water + ?
-flavorings distinctive and pricey. worth it?
in the mouth of the beholder.
may retry. metered parking nearby.
author: Victor G.

description:
Easy Breezy offers more toppings than I've ever seen at any other frozen yogurt shop. The freshly-cut fruit and popping boba glitter like gems and all the toppings are organized neatly. Easy Breezy offers general frozen yogurt toppings such as brownie pieces, crushed Oreo cookies, M&Ms, gummy bears, fruit, chocolate malt balls, and crushed nuts. However, their more adventurous topping include bacon bits, olive oil (pairs well with chocolate and sea salt), maple syrup, potato chips, sweet vinegar, and sea salt (a definite must if one enjoys caramel sauce)!

Some of the froyo flavors I've tried are:
"Chocolate Milk" - after one bite of this I was slapped in the face with the childhood nostalgia of drinking a cold glass full of Nesquik chocolate milk. It's not my favorite chocolate flavor, but kudos to the owners for capturing that kind of taste.

"Vanilla Custard" - Jesus f****** christ, I cannot get enough of this! I'm serious. Easy Breezy sold out of this flavor one day before I could make it to the shop and I almost cried.  It's not a frozen yogurt at all but rather a dense, creamy magical concoction with just the right hit of vanilla. This flavor is my favorite and I buy it every time I walk into the shop.

"Salted Caramel Turtle" - This is the second-best tasting flavor that I've tried. It tastes like salted caramel with a bit of cocoa. One of the dashingly handsome employees told me that salt was accidentally added to the caramel turtle flavor recipe that they were trying to make that morning, but it resulted in such a delicious outcome!

"Peanut Butter" - it's not as heavy as one would expect from something containing peanut butter. The flavor was bold, but not overwhelming to the palate.

"Lemon Squeezy" - sweet, tart, and good for a hot day.
My favorite thing to eat is the vanilla custard topped with fresh strawberries, brownie pieces, crushed almonds, caramel sauce, and a light sprinkle of sea salt on top.

I wish that I lived closer to its location, but I've visited so frequently that a few of the employees even know me by name! Romlo and Victoria were happy to answer any of the questions about froyo ingredients that I threw at them, and when I didn't see my beloved brownie pieces amongst the other toppings Romlo fetched me some from the kitchen right away. 

Easy Breezy is very clean and has a welcoming atmosphere. The background music is good (not overplayed pop music from the radio, thankfully) and it's played at a volume such that I can have a conversation with someone and not be bothered by it. It's a great place to get dessert from or grab a quick snack with friends.

My only complaint would be about the shop's layout. The froyo machines are located are located towards the back, but the majority of the toppings are on an island in the middle of the shop and the sauces and additional toppings are located next to the cashier desk. The customers bump into each other a bit as they navigate through the different stations. If you're looking for a place to study or hang out you'll have better luck elsewhere; the tables are so tiny that there's barely enough room to put a book on them!
author: Mikana C.

description:
I've had some delicious fro-yo here once or twice, but generally speaking, I think this place is so overrated. The yogurt is always so melty when you pour it; it doesn't last more than a minute before your cup looks like soup. The exception to this is the custard (which, let's be honest, is effing amazing), but it's full fat and sort of defeats the purpose of getting fro yo, rather than walking to Holy Gelato (which is way cheaper). 

And the big kicker? It's ridiculously expensive. When I go with my partner, it's $15 minimum for the two of us (and usually closer to $18). We always get the smallest cups and they aren't even full. I don't know the cost per ounce but would guess it's at least 2-3 times that of other yogurt shops. I get that this is a small business and that Irving St rent ain't cheap, but this just seems excessive.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Love the new frozen yogurt pace in the neighborhood. It's a cute shop and I'm in love with froyo. Ever since Berkeley and Yogurtland, I was obsessed. The tartness sometimes and the fruit. I feel...somewhat healthy. 

I finally went into the shop in my neighborhood and I'm so impressed and lucky and I'm going to be coming very often. The cashiers are so nice.  I had tasted the regular tart (which I'm in love with), but the one I got was the Vanilla Custard. It's like ice cream. So I ended up getting some fruit and some candy because why not? 

I'll be back for more tart and fruit and mochi. Popping boba too. 

More expensive than yogurtland, but that's okay. Eat more frozen yogurt.

(everytime I think about this place I think of Easy Breezy Beautiful...Covergirl)
author: Nina Y.

description: Really good fro yo with cool and different flavors you most likely wont find any where else
author: Jupiter J.

description: Definitely a little pricey, but so, so cute! I like the unique flavors and the wide range of toppings. The cashier was very nice and helpful as well, offering to let us sample flavors. Next it's time to see if I can fill out this (adorable) stamp card entirely...
author: Delia Z.

description: Literally come here at least once a week to try out the new flavors. So delicious and extremely friendly staff
author: Raman D.

description:
All the other reviews make me think that my opinion is wrong, but I need to share this anyways. 
The ice cream was fine. nothing special. I like that they had original flavors, even though the Oaxacan Chocolate was a little too spicy for me.  The reason I am giving 3 stars is because I didn't like their service. And maybe I shouldn't compare but I really like that the yogurt café next to my work lets me get my own samples. At Easy Breezy I have to wait for the cashier (who is already busy) has to come and get samples for me. Since I didn't want to wait for her to give anyone in front of me asking for samples, I filled my container with a little bit of all of them. That is when I was left with a lot of Oaxacan Chocolate, because I thought I would like it and I didn't. Had I just gotten a sample on my own, I wouldn't have had this problem.
author: Julianna I.

description:
THE BEST. Is kinda pricey but for the ingredients and what they have to offer it makes sense!
Sweet workers!
author: Albia C.

description: My experience here was awesome. Came in to try the vanilla custard because my friend said she loved it - so I had to try! I got a sample and it won over my taste buds! The frozen yogurt isn't your usual tart taste but tasted like sweet vanilla bean. It was created with "full fat" as oppose to "fat free" which I thought was funny but probably why it's super tasty. I highly suggest to have the vanilla custard when you come. They have lots of toppings to choose from as well, everything is self serve. I got strawberries, waffle chip and almonds to pair with my frozen yogurt and killed it within minutes! Delicious and will be back! Oh and they have cute tattoos of their logo/mascot when you pay :) my cup of frozen yogurt was only $4 :) yum!
author: Amanda C.

description:
I have a sweet tooth for all things frozen, like Olaf, Elsa...just keeding. 

I'm a dessert person, especially when it comes to ice cream and frozen yogurt. Since I've lived in this area, I haven't had frozen yogurt because in comparison to the amount of boba places in the hood, FroYo is rare species. So when this place popped up, I was very eager to try it out.

They have a small selection of flavors in comparison to other places, but it makes up in quality. I love the quality of the yogurt here, Thick, creamy (what?) and the perfect sweetness. My favorite flavor though is actually the custard, which is not yogurt, but it is a must-try-and get-it-every-time-I-come-here. The owner makes it all himself, and it shows.

They have the typical toppings, such as fruit, granola, mochi, fudge, etc. But what gets me are their special toppings, such as the marshmellows from Lucky Charms, potato chips, and bacon. Having sweet and salty options just changed the game.

This place is pricier than other places, but I think it is worth what you get. With the great quality, and variety, and great customer service on top of all of that, this is my go to in this area!
author: Kristine T.

description:
The guy working there seems very happy. He was dancing away as he handed requested samples.  
They have flavors like vanilla, chocolate custard, tart, strawberry, coconut cream pie, and salted caramel, ranging from nonfat, med fat, or full fat.  Label tells you so don't freak. 

My hands are always heavier than my appetite, but all good... It's froyo!
For $.58/lb, you will be asked "for here or to go."
What's the difference? To go= no tax. For here=yes tax.  First time I've encountered that...

Right by ggp so just walk it off and go full fat!
author: Linda T.

description:
Not only is the yogurt here extremely tasty bit it's ultra cute too. And believe me, I know that's a weird thing to say about yogurt. The bright blue logo features a smiling faced yogurt pot with a spoon.. which is a little creepy now I think about it. Eat me, eat me, cannibalize my face and all. Well, whatev.

They have at least six flavours a day and they categorize these from non fat to fill fat. It's a bit weird to have full fat fro-yo, but they do say "worth it" so you want to trust them. They also use different milk (almond, etc) which is cool and they have a fun toppings bar to play with. I'm a big fan of their vanilla bean and chocolate, and most of the other flavors rotate. 

I had a Mexican chocolate last week that left my tongue burning in a cool an unusual way. Anyone with a sweet tooth will love this place.
author: Zara S.

description:
I am in NO way whatsoever any kind of Fro-Yo "snob" or "conosssieur" but I knew after trying it for the first time that it was some of the best I've tried! I was very excited to see the taro flavor on my first time in, so delicious. I was sad that it was gone when I went back the following week, but I somehow equate the frequently changing flavors with freshness, so, I figured, it's okay, the taro will come back. 

Best topping selection i've seen anywhere, and it all looks fresh and clean whenever I go (especially the fruit). So happy it's down the street from my job! Can substitute for a great lunch too, if you just feel like eating something quick and light. Can't beat the location, either...Inner sunset has craved a decent froyo shack for quite some time now.
author: Theresa C.

description: So yummy... It's my first time here after walking by a million times, and I'm happy I stopped in! Absolutely adorable asian guy with a side part and a big smile greeted me and offered samples. There are full fat, low fat and non fat choices, All were pretty delicious! I decided on the Vanilla Custard and Chocolate Custard, no toppings for me today, but they had a large variety.  Welcoming vibe, sweet workers, delicious frozen yogurt. I will definitely be back!
author: Debra K.

description:
I love that there's a frozen yogurt place in my neighborhood. I REALLY love that there are always two non-dairy flavors, and not just anemic fruit ones--Vietnamese coffee! Cake batter! Chocolate!

But. When they opened--which wasn't all that long ago--the cost was about 56 cents an ounce, if memory serves. It's been creeping up and up, and now it's 81 cents per ounce! Last time i was there, I filled one of the smallest cups up about halfway, and it cost between four and five bucks. I can imagine a filled large cup could easily set you back $10 or more.

I know it's expensive to do business in this city, but that's just too much. You can buy a pint of Ben & Jerry's nondairy for what I paid for half a small cup. You can buy a burrito next door--an actual meal--for $5.70. So my trips here will be infrequent from here on out. Silver lining: maybe I'll actually fit into my jeans again.
author: Diane K.

description: Update: still bomb!! But now 73 cents an ounce??? Yiiikes. Good thing I get a discount through work, bc I would not pay full price haha. If "hella Nutella" is back, get it!
author: Christine G.

description:
Wait. How have I not written a review for my little darling yet? I am a legit froyo snob, and normally I'd brush off yet another new froyo shop, but this is the real shit. They have froyo that actually tastes like red bean cake, or coconut, or whatever, not just sugar and artificial vanilla. Their tart is great, and hello custard, full fat, tots worth it. This is also a great addition to the sunset, where choices dwindle after 9pm.. and if you're like me, and dessert stomach is being a little bitch and demanding to be satisfied, having this place close at 10/11pm is nothing short of amazing.

It's not the cheapest froyo there is, especially compared to Yogurtland in South Bay, but it's still reasonable unless you go cray cray with the toppings. Fruit gets heavy. Be warned.

My boyfriend and I have a thing going (or I have a thing going) where I pass by the shop on my way to/from work and text him an update of the flavor on the sandwich board out front (grapefruit! salted caramel! chocolate milk!). It's fun. You should try it.

Yay for taking credit cards, and yay for the punch card.. I'm one away from a free cup, and I think boyf already redeemed one, that fatty.

One suggestion would be.. let us grab our own samples so we don't interrupt the cashier in order for them to stop what they're doing and give us a taste. I think we can handle it ourselves, we promise. If I can save lives, I can sample froyo. Thanks.
author: Vivian H.

description:
I've been walking by this place for months now and finally went in for some froyo on the perfect day - perhaps the first actual day of summer this year. The interior is relatively small, but very friendly and inviting. The flavors are fun - a mix of traditional tarts and unique blends, like the mojito. I went for a swirl of mojito and peanut butter and a separate serving of the coffee/ toffee. 

For toppings I totally took advantage of the granola options - supporting local craft! The price was a little steep, but I guess that's typical of SF. To be honest it wasn't mind blowingly delicious froyo (the best I've had is still in Boston). The froyo didn't have much body and was relatively thin, almost watery. However I appreciate the increasing attention to froyo in this city!
author: Grace O.

description:
I used to love this place. The yogurt itself is good, there is a nice selection of toppings and flavors and the staff has always been helpful. 

The reason why I am giving a one star rating is that this business has shown itself to be flagrantly dishonest. Recently, Easy Breezy posted a sign at the cash register explaining that they had raised prices from .58/oz (if I recall correctly) to .68/oz due to the voter improved increased minimum wage. As of now, the minimum wage has only increased from 10.74 to 11.05. In May it will increase to $12.25. That's a 17% (approximate) price increase compared to a 3% (current)/ 14% (May) minimum wage increase.

Even if Easy Breezy's overhead was ENTIRELY worker wages (which I am sure are only a small piece of the actual overhead), they are STILL raising prices by far more than the minimum wage is increasing.

This is straight up dishonest business.
author: Tom W.

description:
Adorable fro-yo shop but horrible design! This shop is so small, it magnifies the fact that everyone is hustling to get frozen yogurt as you bump into everyone in sight. Human bumper cars...ugh.

Besides that, tonight I was treated to a  banana and chocolate custard swirl with reeses, hot chocolate fudge and a waffle chip. I died. Sooooo good and ultra delicious on a hot day like today. When you're feeling fat, this is the place to come!
author: Christine E.

description: I live down the street and have been going here since the shop opened. Prices have skyrocketed, perhaps to fund the other locations that were opened in a relatively short amount of time. I do enjoy the occasional froyo, despite the froyo fad having already ended years ago. I used to frequent this establishment more in the past, but with the new prices, I just don't think it's worth it. I don't have anything bad to say about the flavors and topping choices. They are just ok. Nothing truly spectacular. Fulfills a quick craving especially on those hot days. Would not wow out of town guests, especially if they're paying $7.50 for it.
author: Marilyn N.

description:
This is such a cute place and their cute little froyo mascot stand definitely caught my attention! I was walking to lunch and passed by this place and new I had to come back for dessert. I'm such a sucker for anything cute!

This place is pretty small and hard to walk around especially when there's a lot of people. I tried a few of their yogurts and thought they were okay. Most if not all of them are organic, so I guess that explains the high per an ounce price. As much as I like unique flavors (like their cucumber), I kind of just wanted something plain so I can load on their extensive toppings bar!

One of the reasons why I rate it so highly (aside from the cute everything) is the toppings bar! Their cookie dough is delicious!! I wish I just got a cupful of that! And all the gummies and chocolates were really good as well. As much as I love sweets, I'm not a huge candy person, but this bar got me going crazy with it!

Sadly, the yogurt itself was not as thick as I would like and it melted pretty fast. But my cup was mostly toppings with a side of yogurt anyways.

Overall, I would come back for the toppings!!
author: Sophia Y.

description: Easy breezy is my favorite fro-yo place. My go to! But why only three stars? Because of the staff. I've been here plenty of times, and they've never greeted me, ever. They just stand at at counter, looking miserable. Like c'mon, it doesn't hurt to crack a smile or welcome guests/customers. My first time coming here, they had banana cream pie, hands down, the best fro-yo I've ever had. It was so good that I came back the next day to get some more. But I haven't seen it since :/ So my boyfriend asked the guy at the counter if we can sample some of the other flavors, he only gave me 1 and walked away. Uh, thanks, I guess. The flavor I get now is vanilla custard, with mochi, sour candy, and a waffle. My boyfriend and I spend about $10 every time we come here, pretty pricey, but worth it. Please bring back banana cream pie, and tell your staff to be a little more... Friendly? K THANKS :)
author: Pauline E.

description: Delicious!  I would've given a 5 star review but service wasn't great.  Haha, it's self-serve but the cashier dude could've at least said one word to us when we were paying.  OH well, I'd still return because the yogurt is awesome.
author: Don A.

description:
I'm a big fan of Easy Breezy. 
It's the perfect combination of the froyo fad and San Francisco earthiness (I mean that in a good way). With everything being organic, and lots of the toppings coming from local places. 

I really like the outdoor seating they have-it's a great way to end a long work day sitting with friends outside with some froyo! 

Will definitely be back. 

However-fair warning, it's not the cheapest froyo money can buy.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Not the best, not the worst.

Odd assortment of flavors (largely vanilla and chocolate in either custard (with egg), yogurt (no egg) or vegan (dairy free). Toppings were decent. Probably not worth a trip there, but not terrible if you are already in the area. 

Oddity- they do the samples for you (you can't just sample yourself even though you serve yourself).
author: Amy L.

description: Best frozen yogurt i've had. Most expensive frozen yogurt i've had. $18 for 2 medium size yogurts with no toppings. Thats outrageous.
author: Jon P.

description:
Well this place is great. It has a bunch of other things besides frozen yogurt. We have been there and got some excellent frozen custard, and some coconut based stuff as well.  This isn't the cheapest frozen yogurt place, but the quality is much better than one of those places. The topping bar had lucky charms that some poor soul had to pick out all those rotten oat bits that they throw in the marshmallows.  The selection of fresh fruit was great as well. There is nothing worse than going to a frogurt place and all they got is bunch of cereal and knock off m+ms but these guys brought it to the table. 
   Great quality stuff, a little bit more money but worth it. Plus if it was dirt cheap I would weigh around 400 lbs.
author: Atom H.

description:
tasty, but pricey (price here equal or more than price at fancy ice cream shops)

vanilla custard was good
lemon ginger, nice lemon but could not taste the ginger
author: Audrey L.

description: My favorite yogurt place in SF! The place is so cute and tiny, although they don't have that many flavors, the flavors that they come out with are the bomb. Every time I come, I always get the vanilla custard and it's my obsession. I usually top it off with granola, almonds, and flax seeds.
