It's a little expensive for yogurt which is why I gave it one star down but other than that, it's the best fro-yo place I've ever tried. The cashiers are always super friendly and they have stamp cards and if sometimes they give you an extra stamp which is super generous of them
author: Celine C.

description:
You gotta get that vanilla bean and vanilla custard game! Super good.

I must say it is a bit more pricey than other froyo spot. 13 bucks for two and we hardly put any toppings!

I'll be back. Quick service, clean, and easy to get in and out.
author: Bern M.

description:
My favorite froyo place - wished I lived closer so I could have it more often!

First of all, it's adorable. Coming from the east coast, I'd never seen this brand before, but the little mascot totally warms my heart every time. The staff is also always super nice - very responsive, quick to provide samples if you're interested, and friendly. There are also punchcards!

I was vegan for a bit, and really appreciated that there are always at least two non-dairy options. Though I now do consume the milks and creams, I still go for the non-dairy peanut butter on each visit because it's just that delicious. I also remember some chai flavor I loved.

Crossroads + so many dinner options + Easy Breezy and Holy Gelato = why can't I live in the Inner Sunset!
author: Shendi X.

description:
easy breezy is a franchise that specialises in natural, organic ingredients.  they currently have two locations, one in inner sunset and another in noe valley.  i'm told they will soon open a third location in the castro.  all of their flavours are clearly labeled as non-fat, med-fat (low fat), or full fat.  they also offer non-dairy options for those who can't have regular milk products.

after sampling a few flavours, i decided to get the non-dairy pumpkin and chocolate custard.  the non-dairy pumpkin uses an almond milk base and i could both see and taste the almond in this frozen treat...it was delicious!  the chocolate custard had regular milk and egg as its base ingredients, and while it wasn't as thick as i've come to expect from frozen custard, the chocolate taste was really good and really smooth.  i topped my fro-yo and fro-custard with some extra dark brownie bites and sliced strawberries.

at $0.58/ounce, this has gotta be one of the most expensive fro-yo shoppes i've been to.  but i'm happy to report that their product is solid and satisfies those with a frozen sweet tooth!

a delicious afternoon treat and i'll definitely return for another cup of fro-yo and or fro-custard the next time i'm in this area!
author: Ellen L.

description:
As has been said by others, two small cups for 16$ and change. One of those was half full with no toppings. Ridiculously priced. And I did not see a sign displaying the price rate, if they had one it was not obvious.

The yogurt itself was decent, interesting variety of flavors. Tastes like standard froyo to me though, nothing special. 

Employees have to serve you the testers one at a time. It is slow, and discouraged me from wanting to try more than 1 flavor. 

For that price, no thank you. Won't be back.
author: Richard G.

description:
I have to start by saying judging on flavor and quality alone this place has the best non-dairy froyo in the inner sunset.  That being said, it is really, really, really expensive and the flavors they choose for the non-dairy froyo are not well though out.  Two of the smallest size froyo with no toppings $15.70.  That is really expensive!...Just saying.  

Regarding the flavors of the non-dairy froyo;
First I have to say, I am lactose intolerant, so I cannot eat froyo unless it is non-dairy.  I'm not actually sure why anyone would choose to eat non-dairy froyo if they can have dairy.  Almost 3 times a week I walk by and check out what the non-dairy flavors are, and I'm always disappointed and confused by the choices.

  I am a big fan of classic flavors like chocolate, vanilla, etc.  And given that they have 2 non-dairy flavors you'd think that they would choose flavors that go together and are different from each other.  I have asked them why they never have chocolate, they say it's because they always have a dairy version of chocolate.  So, that would be great if I could eat dairy, but I can't.  Easy Breezy, please make non-dairy froyo in flavors that sound good when mixed like chocolate and peanut butter instead of candy cane with lavender, or red velvet cake with lemon meringue or vietnamese coffee and grapefruit!?!  If I could eat the dairy froyo, I wouldn't be buying the non-dairy!
author: K S.

description: I came here for the first time yesterday and it was lethal!!! Why have I not been here before? It's probably one of the more expensive and unhealthy frozen yogurt places I've been to lol! But it was Friday.. so there was no diet there!!! I sampled all of them so I got the original tart and the vanilla custard.. mmmm so good! I'm not even gonna tell you all the toppings I added on top but it was worth it!!! I cannot wait to go back!
author: Michelle L.

description: Place is a rip-off; most expensive fro yo I've seen (even in SF). Sample by request only. Teensy water cups that you have to ask for. Extra star for having good non-dairy options (although you'd better cross your fingers that you like them since getting a sample is such a pain).
author: Tom B.

description: Best froyo in the city (esp now that Yogurtland is gone..)? The full fat custards are to die for, and the rest of the low fat and non fat flavors are pretty tasty too. Good selection of toppings as well! Nothing super crazy, but everything you need. My only complaint is that there aren't more nonfat flavors (which was one of the best things about Yogurtland!)
author: Shawna C.

description: Pretty good yogurt! Creamy, smooth, and a decent variety of flavors and toppings. Would go again.
author: Adam C.

description:
My by and I went here tonight. We each got a small yogurt. As we were paying, I held out a full stamped card in front of the cashier girls. She swiped the credit card and goes "oops I already charged the full amount, you can get your free one next time."

Wtf, no apology, no offer to correct the problem. I agree with some posters below that this place engages in deceptive tactics to sell stupid YOGURT. Do you really need that $3????

Never coming back again.
author: Kimberly F.

description: great service... greeted with a smile upon entering, gave us a sample, pointed out the sauces and suggested we come back to try new flavors!!!!
author: David D.

description: Pretty good, but I've had better.  I'll grab it if I'm in the area and feeling like some fro-yo, but I wouldn't seek it out.
author: Rachael S.

description:
I sent my roommate here to pick me up a small frozen yogurt. He called me from the store to tell me the flavors. After he listed them for me I named one and asked him to get me the smallest size. He asked them for a small.

Apparently, the people working there spontaneously decided that this was 'about a quart'. So they filled up a quart container, and then explained that the yogurt was 'sold by weight' and that this weight was $9.00. When he objected, and requested a smaller size, they demanded that since he had ordered it, he had to pay for it.

I thereby acquired $9.00 worth of poor quality yogurt. What I wanted was a small cup of frozen yogurt that should cost about... $3.50... at most. What I and my helpful roommate received instead... was abusive. The entire situation was upsetting and simply wrong.

This business clearly has no concern whatsoever about their customers and is willing to use deceptive tactics to manipulate them. Any business that makes food that we eat, but has this approach to their relationship with their customers is, at best, unworthy of trust, and at worst, simply abusive.
author: Tarm Y.

description: decided to check this place out because of my Lyft rider who works here. She recommended all sorts of flavors, but I went with the vanilla. Before I sampled it, she told me "it's really rich, it's like boardwalk stuff." Omg, she was right. It tasted sooo good and I also sampled the Thai tea flavor which was really good too! She told me that they make all their yogurts from scratch so there's no artificial flavoring, which always great. Will definitely be coming back whenever I crave :)
author: cadence p.

description: Cute lil place. Good flavors, on the pricey side. They frequently change out the flavors, if u dont try it you may not get the chance later!
author: Thuy N.

description: I have been a regular at Easy Breezy for over a few months. Although the yogurt can be pricey, the quality and organic ingrdients keeps me coming back. I like how they keep changing their flavors every week so there's new things to try. However, I consistently get the Vanilla Custard because its so damn delicious. It reminds me of a rich, creamy, and delectable ice cream, but at the same time the taste is much lighter. For the toppings I usually get one waffle cookie because it pairs well with the creaminess of the custard. I am definitely "addicted" to this yogurt!
author: Jessica E.

description:
This place is pretty cool. There are lots of flavors and a huge selection of toppings including brownie chunks and cookie dough. The service was super friendly and the silverware was compostable. 
My only complaint was the price. Of course, it's self serve, so it's easy to have eyes bigger than your stomach. That being said, even the smallest cups are huge, which trick you into dispensing yourself more than you might have gotten with a price sticker in front of you. For two of the smallest cups that were each not nearly full, my friend and I rung up over $14. They charge something like 68¢ an oz, which comes out to almost $11 per pound. I guess you're paying for the variety of  toppings.
There's ample seating, with five or six small tables inside and four benches outside. Overall, a nice experience, but pricy! This is getting three stars cause I really like to know how much I'm paying for something before I buy it, and the after-the-fact giant price tag sort of ruined my appetite.
author: Allxie C.

description:
For all the great yogurt and ice cream shops in San Francisco, it's hard to recommend Easy Breezy. Right after I had purchased my frozen yogurt I had somewhat regretted getting it.

Easy Breezy is presented in a fun colorful way. The interior has a lot of teal along with a lot of wood grain. What's nice is that they clearly state allergens for each of their yogurt flavors. I had gotten a swirl of dark chocolate and cookies-n-cream. Easy Breezy uses coconut milk in their dark chocolate. I can definitely taste it. I think I may like the cookies-n-cream more. It's not the flavor that bothers me, it's the texture. It's way too icy for my tastes. For some reason this frozen yogurt melts incredibly fast. The toppings bar is standard fare. They did have some unique stuff like mochi and flavor balls, yet the fruit doesn't look appetizing or fresh.
_____

Average yogurt spot with some interesting flavors and ingredients.
author: Michael H.

description:
I like to think of myself as somewhat of a fro-yo connoisseur, so I feel like I have a pretty good grasp of what's bad, average or great fro-yo. Easy Breezy definitely belongs -  along with only a couple of other places in the city - in the latter category. Despite having lived in the sunset for seven months and taking the N pretty much every day, I didn't try Easy Breezy until about a month ago. The tart is actually tarty, and while I can't claim to have tasted ALL of the other flavors they have offered, the ones that I have tasted have all been pretty rich. 

As for the toppings, they have an interesting selection. I think this is the first place I've ever seen potato chips offered as topping. The cookie dough is made without eggs and the berries are fresh.

The only thing I don't love about it is the layout of the store, which can be really crowded on sunny days. Still, since that has nothing to do with the quality of the fro-yo and the location is overall cute and clean, I don't feel that it warrants removing any stars.
author: Vilde E.

description:
Easy Breezy is perhaps one of the cutest fro-yo shops in the Bay Area. HOW CAN YOU RESIST THAT CUTE YOGURT DESIGN!? AHH

One step into the store and you start to feel super giddy- just like stepping inside a Sanrio or some Asian stationary store.

I love their designs of how their chalkboard lists out the flavor. 
The one flavor that truly stands out on its own is the custard. DAT Custard. It's sweet and creamy goodness makes you even wonder why you even consider getting the tart in the first place. 
Each week they seem to have a different specialty flavor such as lemon tart, tiramisu and even MANGO LASSI (my fave).  

They have a large variety of toppings to place, such as a waffle chip, huge chunks of cookie dough and even..hot sauce. 

The prices are a bit more expensive than your standard fro-yo place but personally, I'm willing to fork it down for a place that makes such good fro-yo and makes me feel so happy upon stepping in. 

The one quipe I have about this place is perhaps the orientation of how everything else. Perhaps Easy Breezy didn't account as to how busy the place was going to be but having the topping station right in the center of the store provides limited space for people to walk around, try samples and purchase at the counter. 

It's so EASY to step inside and get some,  breezy!
author: Jennifer W.

description: thank you, easy breezy, you're an inspiration!  after paying as much for a frozen yogurt as i would for a warm meal nearby, i went home and froze some fresh fruit.  the next day i put in into my blender and i had me a great frozen yogurt type dessert for about a buck and a half!  this place is just silly it's so expensive.  go back to noe valley.
author: Alexandria B.

description:
wow. such ez. so brez. very covr gurl. or mebe iz mabeline.

no mattar, doge luv yogart so such excite when open such close 2 hom.

1. shib iz obsess w/ mochi. such addicted. so shib many heppy when find out abt mochi in topping sekshun. +10 pt. almost pee in stor.

2. wow such yogart flavor! Hav so variety of flavur. shib trai exotic grapefrut flavur and normale tarte. wow. very impres. such not 2 over creamy, and much not 2 much icy. many perfect blend. very similar to shibe poop. shib such excite at perfect consistency. cud not doo bettar myself with shib butt. grapefrut flavore iz much subtle, which shib much like. tarte flavur also not 2 tart butt still subtle sweet. Mmmm. Shib drool.

Inside looks much hip. wow. much hardwood. shibe feel such organik. green doge. such cute. too cute. shibe vomit blood. jaja.

ez brez. wow. want 2 b cover doge.
author: Doge S.

description:
The best froyo.

BAM. I said it. Better than Fraiche, Yogurtland, Tuttimelon, all those guys... Why?

It's fresh, Organic sometimes - and every flavor is delicious: Salted Caramel*, Nutella*, Vietnamese Coffee*, Vanilla Custard, Pistachio, Chocolate Milk - it's the highest quality and taste this froyo-obsessed girl has tried.

Ingredients, like the froyo, rotate. Some days they have organic raspberries, strawberries, blueberries, mangoes - they always have toasted coconut, dark chocolate mini chips, *hot* fudge and caramel - so many toppings. 

I already went through a punch card +  the icon is so cute. A big anthropomorphized froyo. 

*The best.
author: Maria A.

description: A very friendly spot to enjoy a froyo on Irving ST, delicious toppings.,a little priecy but it worths it, I tried the almond milk froyo for the first time and liked it so far! I would Totally recommand It
author: Ka L.

description:
Even though it's the only yogurt place in Inner Sunset, I have to say this place is pretty darn good. My favorite is the full-fat frozen custard... let's not kid ourselves. Frozen yogurt is like ice cream, it's not that good for you health-wise, but it's never really stopped anyone before. If you're hungry for some good dessert, then don't deprive yourself of the full-fat goodness. 

It's not cheap compare to some other yogurt places, but it is the only one around the area and it is quite decent. Their toppings are always well-stocked and fairly fresh. It's a win in my book!
author: Aleck L.

description: One small and one moderate size yogurt cup with minimal toppings  came to $16.10. I had to ask the price twice as I was in shock. Another patron on the bench outside was similarly appalled as she paid over $19 for her and her child. I realize San Francisco is expensive but this is ridiculous! Not worth it!
author: craig w.

description:
I wish this place existed when I still lived in the inner sunset! 
I got the chocolate milk and original tart flavor here. The chocolate milk was really good and tasted like a frozen chocolate milk, as expected, but next time I would probably get another flavor or a smaller portion since it started to get too sweet. Original tart was tarty and delicious, no complaints here!
Service is really sweet as well. The woman was asking everyone if we were getting our food for here or to go and clarified that it was due to being charged sales tax and she didn't really care what we said. I appreciate the honesty!
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood, replacing the old toy store (I do miss the old toy/gift store). 

I had a hankering for frozen yogurt with mochi and fruit balls, and they delivered. A bit on the pricier side.  The topping island could be bigger.
author: Grace M.

description:
Our favorite froyo. 

Nice decor and the flavors are unique.  A step above the other chain froyo shops.

This place is just as good as Noe & 24th... but I've only seen milk chocolate at Noe.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
Organic self-serve frozen yogurt with a large variety of fun flavors! I tried the mint mojito, vanilla custard, and taro flavor. They were all amazing! There's also a non-dairy flavor made with almond milk for those who don't eat dairy products!

Information about all of the flavors are displayed, showing the milk used, percentage of fat. And all of the frozen yogurt is made with organic milk. 

The mint mojito flavor was made with low fat milk and fresh mint (frozen yogurt has tiny bits of mint leaves -delicious)! It was light, refreshing, and definitely one of my favorite flavors. The vanilla custard flavor was made with whole milk and eggs. This was the most rich and creamy flavor. I loved it. The last flavor I tried was the seasonal taro flavor. The taro taste was very strong and it was definitely more flavorful than yogurtland's taro flavor. Definitely try this flavor if you're a fan of taro! : D

The shop is pretty small and has very limited bench seating. Like most self-serve froyo places, there is a self-serve toppings bar with extensive topping choices and the yogurt is weighed by the ounce at the cash register.

The whole shop is incredibly adorable and kept very clean. The interior and exterior is decorated with their cute yogurt cup man mascot character. From my experience, the service is wonderful! The staff is very friendly, informative, and enthusiastic about the frozen yogurt they serve.

I highly suggest giving this place a try if you love frozen yogurt!
author: Monica T.

description: I had the coconut cream pie and original tart and it blew me away! By far my new favorite frozen yogurt joint! Who can complain with such amazing customer service and amazing flavors! I can't wait to try the new other flavors!
author: Nicole H.

description:
After eating at Nopalito, I had a dessert craving (always have room for dessert!) and so upon fellow Yelper Ringo M's recommendation, I decided to stop here for a quick sweet fix. 

Upon entering, the yogurt options are displayed towards the back of the store. If you're looking to sample a flavor, just ask the helpful employee and they provide a sample serving of your desired flavor for you. I ended up going with the classic tart and the froyo was creamy, tart as advertised, with a hint of sweetness. I'm not too big of a fan of icy froyo and Easy Breezy did not disappoint. 

After getting a full small cup with strawberries and mochi, the total came out to be around $5. Not bad for a satisfying, healthy (at least that's what I like to tell myself) dessert!
author: Heesun L.

description:
Don't let the name mislead you.  Easy Breezy is much more than your run-of-the-mill self-service storefront.   The creamy, smooth, indulgent flavors like Nutella and egg custard taste true to their ingredients and come out at the right consistency.

Yes, this fro yo has the unfair advantage of a bit more fat than your typical Pinkberry.  But it's worth every bite.
author: Tracy K.

description:
Easy Breezy is a new frozen yogurt/dessert stop to the Inner Sunset neighborhood, offering customers with a great variety of made-in-house self-serve frozen yogurt. The shop is similar to a lot of the self-serve fro-yo places you'll find throughout the city - with the toppings stand and a range of flavors to choose from. Great thing about this place is that the flavors are quite unique, many of which are made with organic and non-dairy based products such as almond milk for those of you looking for lactose-free and/or more healthy conscious desserts. They've got some awesome flavors including a Custard flavor, which I highly recommend, in addition to a Banana and Nut flavor and Lemon Tart. They rotate three of their flavors once a week while keeping four standard flavors, which keeps things interesting.

The quality of the ingredients and the fro-yo flavors is pretty unique so I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who's looking for something a little different from the other, more common, fro-yo spots like Nubi and Red Mango. Expect to pay $5+ for a standard size with toppings. If you're looking for something refreshing for a late afternoon snack or post-dinner dessert, Easy Breezy is a great new option along Irving!
author: Cheston W.

description: If you want to try the most expensive yogurt in town, this is your place.  I spent $10 for a average size yogurt.  Come on guys.  The lady in front of me spent 37.00 for 4 yogurts.  I don't care if you milked the cow yourself, the yogurt is not that special.
author: Denise O.

description: The pricing here is insane. As in whoever runs this business should seek mental help. I could have gone out to dinner for what I paid for a just OK frozen yogurt. Not cool to be ripped off so blatantly.
author: Alice W.

description:
Tried to place out after dinner on 9th at Craw Station last night.

Flavors I got:

Original Tart (Duh)
Nutella
Snickerdoodle

AMAZING and I literally dreamt of the taste all day today.

Get a loyalty stamp card - you'll be back again fa sho.
author: Nhu D.

description:
This place is my favorite ever; the frozen yogurt; for me; is the best one. The guys are pretty nice. 
The flavors are really good, but I always go for the same one. And also they have a good variety of sweet stuff to put it, sauces. I love easy breezy.
author: Agostina D.

description: I stumbled here after dinner, and I love it! It's such a cute and cozy space. I tried the vanilla custard flavor, and it was sooooo good!! It brought me back to having softees in New York! The toppings are a pretty good selection.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Chocolate chip cookie dough topping? Hell yes.

Flavors like nutella (did you dip your finger in the jar?), birthday cake (lemme lick the bowl please) and peanut butter (delish, is this organic??)? Word.

Gluten, no gluten, full fat, low fat, dairy, dairy free? Sure.

As one of my friends said when we went here, "I should have got the bigger cup." 

Damn straight. Gimme some froyo, yo!
author: imelda j.

description: This was a typical frozen yogurt place but I liked how the girl working was so nice and gave her recommendations on what was popular. I liked the original tart and the lemon ginger zinger. Good place to get some dessert after dinner.
author: Richard K.

description: Pricey in my opinion...but it's worth it! I love the "Busta Lime", it isn't yogurt though. But it's icy and tarty. The topping selection could be improved with more toppings. The toppings are suppose to be organic I believe and all the furniture seem to be recycle wood. In addition, the cups and spoons are biodegradable aka compostable. Overall, I would definitely go back. Plus the staff is so nice handing out samples in and out of the store and they got tattoos!
author: M L.

description:
Stopped by Easy Breezy since it was new and I was in the area.  Cute little shop from first look and then we stood there looking at the flavor offerings.
 I wanted the tasting cups and the worker was helping some customers that were paying.  I've been at other establishments and the worker can see you would like some tasting cups and then hand them to you but not here.  So we stood around and looked at the toppings until the worker was free.  I asked for tasting cups and then he asked which flavors I'd like to taste.  Strange. So I told him and he got the cups and gave me my tastings. I was a little off put by this method so immediately grabbed a cup and got some froyo and toppings and paid and booked it immediately.  For some reason I just didn't like that vibe though I guess some like that customer service aspect.  I'm just used to doing it myself and when and how much...

Anyways, the actual froyo itself was good! Creamy and tasty though at .58 cents an ounce it hits the wallet.  Not sure if I'd be back. I think maybe if they put up signage for how it works with the tasting cups etc that may eliminate people from standing around and waiting. Also what do they do when the store is slammed?
author: Julie F.

description:
This place is ridiculously expensive. $0.71/oz compared to $0.29/oz from yogurt land! Nothing distinguished it from other chains of frozen yogurt, making its pricing completely unjustifiable. To make it worse, the guy wouldn't even let us try the different flavors ourselves, he'd ask us exactly what flavor we wanted to try, and would fill the cups himself making it awkward for us to ask for another flavor tasting. He seemed to be very stingy about the tasting, and would keep very limited tasting cups hidden behind the counter. They also cleverly placed the pricing in a spot not very noticeable. The ambience was below par as well.
Definitely not on my list for revisits!
author: Atul S.

description:
They have almond milk-based frozen yogurt, and it's completely vegan*, and it's amazing.  The flavors rotate, so you should go all the time to try them all.  They also have a peanut butter hot fudge type syrup, which is 100% peanut butter, heated up and melty and yummy.  I love this place.

*I wrote them to confirm. :)
author: Jenn M.

description: Great staff, friendly owner, and the yogurt is tasty and creamy. You can choose from fat free to full fat flavors. They also have a large selection of fresh toppings and sauces. Everything is self serve.
author: Eugene M.

description: One of my favorite frozen yogurt shops in SF. The owner is an artisan chef in the kitchen.  "Mexican Chocolate" made me a fan for life!
author: Katharine H.

description:
Great addition to the neighborhood!  Yogurt is tasty and there are a bunch of flavors to choose from.  Toppings are diverse and flavorful.  I love that it is pay by the ounce and you get to add your own toppings, compared to many other yogurt places that you are stuck with whatever they give you.  

There are a bunch of reviews talking about the price.  Personally, I think it is far cheaper than most yogurt places I've been to.  The two times I've been here it is about $3-4 for a normal sized portion.  At a similar national yogurt chain it would probably cost $4-6 for the same size.  I do agree that if you don't know what you are doing it can be a little confusing when you walk in, but it's a brand new place and I'm sure the owners and employees will work to make the flow a little easier.
author: Colin W.

description:
My new go-to froyo place. I strongly believe that no matter how full you are, there is ALWAYS room for froyo and/or ice cream.

That being said, Easy Breezy's froyo is THE best. The full-fat vanilla and chocolate flavors made with custard is well worth the additional fat and cals. Every time I've gone, they always have those flavors plus tart and a vanilla option. The others change depending on the season, there's usually one made with coconut milk, one with almond milk? It just depends. 

The other day I went in and they had cake batter and apple pie flavor. The apple pie tasted like legit apple pie...in a froyo. I don't know how else to better explain. 

Organic ingredients and a much needed addition to the neighborhood! Make sure to get your stamp card! I would also agree with other Yelpers in that prices are in line with Fraiche (another must try, I may add!) but you pay-per-ounce. 

Pro-tip: Make sure you line your froyo cravings when Hardly Strictly is NOT going on. Bad decision and what a nightmare trying to find parking!
author: Alison N.

description:
Didn't care for most of the yogurts but the fatty custard was pretty good. Very pricey compared to better places. 

Not a big fan of the anal-retentive sampling system where you gotta plead with the "Cup Master" to free up and do his magical process to dispense very little into the tiny cups. As though you are not worthy of handling them without getting paper cuts or somehow compacting 17 ounces into them for free.  Oh, and he'll give you the stink eye when he serves you, like you are interrupting a sonnet he was working on. Pick your top two guesses because that's about all the lifting he's able to tolerate.
author: T J.

description:
Even though this took the place of my favorite novelty/gift store, the temptation of frozen yogurt was too much for me to keep away.

I am usually on fan of nut-flavored frozen treats because they often look, taste, or look & taste artificial. To my very pleasant surprise, the Pistachio frozen yogurt here was not too green, a little gritty in texture, and had a nutty undertone. All of this made me feel confident that real nuts were involved in the production process. The Easy Breezy Lemon Squeeze was refreshing, light, & tasted like real lemons; I could have used a little more pucker though. No first trip to a frozen yogurt parlor is complete without trying the Plain. The texture was good but it was not as tart as I have had at other places.

The prices are a little higher than other frozen yogurt establishments in the area, but given the superior flavor & the quality ingredients, I am happy to splurge...although probably on s often as I used to.
author: Karen S.

description:
Somehow I once thought frozen yogurt was a healthy dieting choice. Nope. Unless you have one taste.

I think I was under that impression from all the fake ice cream I used to eat. Low calorie. No taste. Fart city for hours afterwards.

So when I have a frozen yogurt, I consider it a treat. And as long as I do that, I let myself have whatever I want. Occasionally.

So I occasionally come here. Like every Friday. Apple pie with graham cracker topping one Friday. Plain vanilla with cookie bits today. Love this stuff. If it lasted long enough to take home I would be in trouble. Cause I like to have a treat for breakfast too.

Highly recommended. And perhaps a tad more cost than other frozen yogurt places in the area--- but WORTH IT!!!!!!

Try the peanut butter flavor. with a bit of chocolate topping....treat yourself!!!!
author: Dani K.

description:
This is a very good frozen yogurt place! I am usually not a fan of frozen yogurt because things like chocolate, banana, and vanilla taste gross to me when they are low fat.

 Eezy Breezy has options that taste nice and refreshing when they are low fat,  though. The lemon ginger is really good.  They also have those fun spherical toppings that burst when you bite into them. 

I'll definitely be back to try the frozen custard!
author: Sarah M.

description: Quality seems to have gone down ever since the introduction of the Easy Breezy Groupon. I went last week with my family and discovered that instead of being creamy and smooth, the frozen yogurt was a bit watery and grainy. They have great toppings and great flavors when the consistency of the yogurt is just right. Otherwise, it was a pretty disappointing visit.
author: Alice H.

description:
taro, tart, vanilla, strawberry, chocolate milk, chocolate banana were most if not all the flavors of the day when I came here. all were nonfat or low fat except for custard which was "full fat" and needless to say the most delicious. all flavors were good, but we liked strawberry and custard the most. I'm sad they didn't have mint mojito and banana cream pie that night. hopefully next time.

they have all the toppings you can think of - candy, chocolate, cap'n crunch, mochi, fruit, yogurt chips, cookie waffles, madeleines, fresh cookie dough, and more! they even have Li hing powder and sriracha! it's nice that they have self-serve water on the counter too. it's a small place with limited seating inside so be prepared to eat your froyo in freezing Sunset weather if you come at a busy time.

the only annoying thing was the fact that the guy working here will not let you sample your own yogurt. he literally refused to give us a sample cup and filled it for us each time regardless of how long the check-out line was getting. I mean c'mon, do we really look like we're going to loiter in your tiny froyo establishment just to sample yogurt because we're too cheap to pay $5? their system is very awkward and inefficient.
author: Stephanie G.

description: First and Foremost... The prices here are waaaaay to high. Other than that... the ingredients are high quality and samples are plentiful if you are unsure about what you want to have. The staff is friendly and welcoming. Again... The prices are absurd for what you get.
author: None O.

description:
Trendy place. $0.58/oz is more than other places nearby.

Their original tart + very dark brownie is really good.

Good place to chill with friends after a nice dinner around the area.
author: Richard C.

description: This place looks so cute! I am always sold and attracted by cuteness. This is a tiny self-serve yogurt shop with a few benches to sit on in the store front. My favorite is their chocolate custard and it's labeled "full fat". It's probably the reason why it was so good! Extremely creamy and chocolatey and perfect temperature! When I say perfect temperature when it comes to froyo, what I mean is its stiff when you pump it into your cup rather than soft and melts quickly. I like mine colder and on the stiffer side. They don't have a whole lot of options for toppings and my complaint is that when it's busy, the topping bar can get really messy and gross. They have a lot of delicious flavors and made from organic ingredients. I will definitely come back for anything that's full fat! They're a little more pricier than most yogurt shops but it's the quality you can taste.
author: Janny S.

description: This place is by far the best froyo shop in the city. They make all of their flavors in-house and their are all made from natural ingredients. Their toppings are also amazing...I mean cmon, potato chips and peanut butter. Yes! Also their owner is super sweet and good people. Check them out, you won't be disappointed!
author: J P.

description:
They offer a total of 8 flavors. Four are always the same: tart, full-fat custard, fat free vanilla, and low fat chocolate.  The other four more or less rotate weekly.  Tip: check their Facebook page for the flavors of the week, updated every Monday/Tuesday.  My favorite flavors so far have been coffee, pistachio, and peanut butter, especially the latter two.  Hope to see nonfat mint soon

As of a few weeks ago, one machine has a dedicated nondairy flavor which uses an almond milk base (previously it was a sorbet).  My boyfriend is allergic to dairy (not lactose intolerant) so we are pleased about the change to almond milk, which provides a creamy smoothness that is far more delectable than the old sorbet.  We are however very disappointed that the only flavor had been banana.  Boyfriend hates bananas, I like bananas, but for frozen yogurt, I'll pass. 
We hope they will have two nondairy flavors with the almond milk base. Would love to see a nondairy version of more popular flavors, such as Very Berry (blueberry and strawberry)

I think they changed the dimensions of the regular cup size, it seems much wider and shorter than before. I think that makes it easier to spread out your toppings and yogurt flavors, but you're also more likely to underestimate how much you've put in your cup and pay more than you may have expected.

Staff are all friendly and provide great customer service.
author: J B.

description: Delicious, but I was a little surprised at the price tag. 16 bucks for yogurt?!
author: ivy c.

description:
I've tried tart and vanilla. Both were good.  The fruit toppings are fresh. The cookie dough is weird-too salty. I appreciate the self serve hot fudge. 
It's nice that they're so helpful with letting you taste flavors, but I had to wait for like 5 min with my melting treat once because they were understaffed and helping people taste when I was ready to pay.  
Still delicious though.
author: Rocio G.

description:
Decent yogurt, but has definitely gone down hill since it opened.  I loved this place when it opened.  It used to have 5 or 6 options for fresh fruit, now only 3.  

And the last time I was in there I had a free card.  I put my yogurt on the scale and apparently I was an ounce over the limit....They wouldn't let me use it.  Poor customer service imo.

And it's almost doubled in price....$0.71 an ounce?  it was in the 30 or 40's when it opened.  Never going back.
author: Joe A.

description: This place is just like the name says.  The employees pour the soft serve and you pour on all the toppings you want.  It's quick and easy and the soft serve flavors are tasty and amazing.  I'd totally go back and recommend others do the same.  The price is very reasonable and the interior is bright and fun.
author: Shaun W.

description:
This place was really good! This is another self serve froyo place but the flavors are yummy. I like how they tell you if the flavor is fat free, medium fat or full fat. You can try some flavors before dumping it in your bowl and I really liked the original. Tart just the way I like it. Will think bout this place next time I'm in the area mmmm

P.s. - they have temporary tattoos of their little mascot available at the check out. How adorable~
author: Ruby C.

description:
I would put Easy Breezy more in line with places like Fraiche in terms of price, but it's pay-by-the-ounce like YogurtLand or Moppi and I think the combination is a bit off-putting to people. While Easy Breezy is undoubtedly more expensive, the higher-quality yogurts and ingredients make up for that, in my opinion. While it's not unusual to be able to fruit on your froyo, I don't think I've ever been to a place that had fresh cut figs on offer. 

SPECIAL EAST COAST NOTE: If you are from a Mid-Atlantic state or vacationed on the coast in NJ, DE, MD, or VA the name Kohr Bros may ring a bell. A cold, sweet, and creamy bell... you know I had high hopes for this metaphor but it's not working out. Anyhow, the Custard flavor at Easy Breezy tastes exactly like Kohr Bros. frozen custard. One bite brought back vivid memories of warm summer nights strolling along the boardwalk with my family. If this hits you right in your nostalgic place, you owe it to yourself to get to Easy Breezy and give it a try. 

And if not, you can still load up your Chai flavored froyo with fresh cut figs, so what are you complaining about.
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Decided to try out this place after seeing the Apple Pie flavor sign outside. Wow it's not just Apple pie but has graham cracker and other flavors in it. Really tasty! Most of their flavors are organic too so they don't have the chemical taste that some other froyo places can have.

Staff was very friendly and explained that the owners are from San Francisco and all the froyo is made there from scratch in the back. It would be easy to setup a generic froyo shop here so I'm glad to see a local business open up with some character.

The custard flavor is made out of actual custard and is very tasty! Warning its full on fat content though, no low fat there. Very legit froyo spot, I will be back again soon.
author: Kentaro F.

description:
A and I were walking by on a random Tuesday afternoon a couple of weeks ago and noticed this brand spanking new froyo place.  Now, we're not big froyo fans, but a little dessert every now and then never hurt anyone.

We walked inside and were greeted right away by Mr. Breezy himself.  We know this because his name tag said "Mr. Breezy."  He gave us sample after sample after sample and told us that he makes all of the froyo himself in the back. 

After all the sampling, we decided to share a vanilla / chocolate swirl and loaded it with toppings.  It was pretty heavy, but still relatively inexpensive.

I would go back to try different flavors because it's not too expensive, not very far from home, and it's pretty darn tasty.
author: Kris L.

description:
Fro-yo is my go-to non-guilty dessert, so after stuffing my face with Chinese food, my friend and I headed to this cute little place. We were greeted by the friendly worker, who offered us samples of pretty much every flavor. She also did this without getting annoyed, like other ice cream or fro-yo places do. 

I went with the Strawberry Breeze and Original Tart topped with fresh strawberries, blueberries and peanuts. Both were just the right amount sweet, considering I don't have the biggest sweet tooth. Their flavors rotate daily, some of the others on this day were Red Bean Cake, Chocolate Milk and Egg Custard, many low-fat and they have vegan options. You can't go wrong with any of their toppings which include fresh fruit, cookie dough, candy and hot syrups ranging from chocolate, caramel, strawberry and peanut butter. The price isn't too bad either. 

I would definitely recommend if you're in the area, solid fro-yo, can't really go wrong.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I usually think fro yo is a waste of calories. But this is worth a muffin top and a bubble butt. I know, I know it's low fat. But gurl, who you kidding with the chocolate sauce and potato chip crumbles? Be prepared to pay a Lincoln for half a cup or a Hamilton
for a full cup. So decide now if you want half a cup of fro yo or fat ass burrito at Gordo's. The choice is yours.
author: Sophia C.

description: Cute decor Frozen Yogurt spot with delicious unique flavors. Loved their Vanilla Bean and Vanilla Custard flavor, but to be honest.... wouldn't pay $5 for half filled cup of yogurt. A tad bit on the PRICEY side for yogurt.
author: Joyce P.

description: I will start with one negative.  PRICE.  Hardly a one $.  That said, they switch up flavors, vanillas chocolates, fruit flavors, etc. and have a good selection of toppings.  Frequent lines out the door but the wait is never long.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Love that this shop took over the tutti fruiti store on Irving.  I was so in need of an ice cream shop or froyo place to walk down to when I'm having a bad day at work or need a sweet treat.  I love the lemon and custard soft serves...as well as the coffee and other flavors they have.

they have a variety of toppings...even bacon!  Great place! Great addition to Irving!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: The tart flavor with strawberries added on top is divine. They have a lot of unique flavors that other froyo shops seem to not have.
author: Tommya D.

description: My favorite froyo place thus far! Better than yogurt land, pinkberry and all.  They have very unique flavors of froyo that's different from the other places I've been to!  They also say the froyo is organic and they tell you which flavors are made with full fat/ non fat/ medium fat/ almond milk.  How amazing is that! My favorite flavor so far is Basil.. and have been going back for it, but haven't seen it since.  Bring back the Basil flavor!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: inexpensive yeah right! unless you get a baby scoop its not worth it, this place is for the wealthy, 22 bucks for 2 frozen yogurts hahah BYE
author: Yarrow S.

description: This might be the best froyo I've ever had. The chocolate and vanilla custards are always great (and staples on the menu board) but I love their peanut butter and apple pie flavors too which are part of their rotating flavors. It's little pricey (79 cents an ounce) for froyo but I've never had a flavor I didn't like.
author: San Fran G.

description: BEST fro yo and Mr. Breezy is just amazing!!! My daughter is fighting brain cancer and she LOVES visiting EB whenever we are in town for treatment. She was so excited on our last trip that Mr. Breezy was there, she couldn't wait to meet him and talk to him. He was great with her!! He chatted with us and was just super friendly before we left he gave her a EB tee. Morgan wears her Easy Breezy tee all the time. What a charming little place!! I just recently tried Basil/Lime on this trip and YUMMO!!! If you like down to earth, kid friendly and fantastic Fro Yo, this is your place!!
author: Cresha C.

description: I love frozen yogurt and I love organic ingredients. Easy Breezy is the place to be for a delicious treat for yourself & anyone. I haven't been to any place in San Francisco that has organic frozen yogurt along with the exotic flavors like Easy Breezy has.  Every time I go to any of three Easy Breezy locations in San Francisco the stores are always very clean (which to me is very important).
author: Jorge M.

description:
Best frozen yogurt shop in the city!!! All the flavored are freshly made with fresh ingredients every week and they are all so unique! I first discovered easy breezy on 24th street in Noe where I work and was so excited to find it opening on Irving closer to where I live! 
The staff is amazing there especially Toree she is so friendly and helpful! Definitely one of the best new hot spots in the inner sunset.
author: Haley M.

description:
Easy Breezy! Where do I even start.  These guys are awesome! I work just around the corner so naturally I'm a regular (merchant discount what! what!).  They have a great staff here.  Always smiling and stoked to give me my sample cup (probably because they know I'll fill up the giant cup, haha)! Sometimes they even pass out free samples on the sidewalk.  

Rain or shine, I'm always in the mood for this place. Literally, one time it was pouring out and we ran to Easy Breezy because we had a hankerin'.  I looove the coconut dream, strawberry, taro, and vanilla bean flavors.  I can't resist their cute little toppings station either.  I always get blackberries and brownie bits.  

#1 - Bomb froyo
#2 - Legit staff
author: Tara C.

description: Chocolate and vanilla custard were really good! Very rich and flavorful:) Good service, offered if we wanted to sample some. Good toppings :) tried the Vietnamese coffee one and it was really strong, but still good. The place is really small and cute!
author: Jacquelyn W.

description:
I would give this place a 3 star but I don't really want to. If you are wondering why is because the staff there are RUDE.

My boyfriend and I went to grab some yogurt after dinner. I looked up yelp and found this place and it had good ratings so we decided to go here. We walked in and there was no customers and two staff working in the front of the cashier. They both looked at us and didn't say Hi or any kind of greetings. My boyfriend and I wanted to try out some of the flavors and we asked one of the girls if we can have few sample cups and she she told me the other girl will help me. So I ask the other girl...and she says WHAT to me when I asked her if she can help me.. REALLY? What kind of customer service is this? and she only let us try one flavor. RIDICULOUS. It seemed like she didn't want to serve us. If they don't want to serve us why bother to have them serve it to us when they can just give us 2 or 3 sample cups and do it ourselves? I'm not exactly sure if they were just being racist, but there was these other people who came in and they were white and they're attitude changed. They greeted them so happily and told them how the place works. When we walked in they didn't even tell us it was self serve or anything. I just thought this place was RUDE and unprofessional. 

I will never recommend anyone here nor will my boyfriend and I come here again. I feel bad for the owner here. I'm not exactly sure if they know that their staff is like that or maybe the owner don't care? 

I NEVER experienced this kind of service at ANY yogurt place. This place is the first! These are the exact words what my boyfriend said when we walked out of the place 
"I feel like we're not wanted here" that's exactly how we felt.... BLAH
author: Sora K.

description:
I decided to check this out while walking around my neighborhood and was happy to see a frozen yogurt place open up as I do loooove my frozen yogurt. It's a cute little place with friendly staff (the gentleman behind the counter was very nice, enthusiastic, and offered to help me if I wanted any tastings) I like that they have a dairy free option using an almond milk base (bring back the pistachio, please!) and a few other rotating flavors that range from non-fat to full fat options. It doesn't have a ton of flavors, which is good, in my opinion, since I sometimes find places with 15+ flavors overwhelming. There are plenty of toppings to choose from - and it's kept CLEAN and organized. 

The only drawback is that it is a little pricier than I would like. I wasn't expecting to pay over $5 for a small cup that was half full with about 8 pieces of mochi (maybe that is what sent it over, though), But it's not so bad when it's an occasional treat. 

Oh yeah, and it's open late, so you can get your dessert fix after eating dinner at Nopalito.
author: H C.

description:
I was just there and this place is a JOKE....every single yogurt shop I've been to GIVES you tasting cups to taste test the flavors.  This yogurt shop has a clerk take a tasting cup out of her apron pocket and serve you a taste.  This is so lame.  When I asked her why she said because they can give you a better serving and they (the clerks) can interact with the customers. Really REALLY?!?!?  More than half of the serving she gave me I threw in the trash!! She said I could talk to the manager but of course the manager wasn't there.  So giving them a bad review on yelp is how I get to complain!
This place is not going to make it......as if they care!!  People don't want to be controlled about what they eat and drink.  This is the most lame policy I have ever heard.

I will never go back there and I'm going to tell my friends not to go there!

This place probably will be closing soon because management is too stupid to know that you need to give people what they want and NOT what you WANT to give them!  Your policies are stupid!
author: Miriam K.

description: We stumbled across this little place on a recent trip to Golden Gate park.  In search of some froyo, we found Easy Breezy and made the trek out of the park and across to Irving St.  Frozen yogurt is definitely a hit-or-miss thing; there are tons of shops and most carry decent froyo. Easy Breezy surpasses most of them in two areas: first. they have awesome flavors! I had a Oaxacan chocolate flavor that was really delicious - it had a hint of spice that was amazing. Also try the custard flavor with whole milk -its creamy-ness was unbelivable.  Secondly. the selection of toppings were unusually perfect. They had berries, fruit, Oreo cookies, and stuff like shaved Andes mints - not just the usual sprinkles and gummy stuff that most places carry.  And finally, its self-serve, which IMHO is the best way to get frozen yogurt.  The staff was very friendly and helpful too - they let us taste a few samples before we made our decision.   So Easy Breezy is worth it, if you are in search of higher quality frozen yogurt.
author: David Z.

description: I really like it! It's not super cheap, but they usually have new flavors every week. And of course the typical tart, vanilla and chocolate! Also a lot of toppings to choose from!
author: Mari Carmen M.

description: The yogurt is good but whoa, it's expensive for yogurt-- $0.68 an ounce! Then again this is in San Francisco, so it's not surprising. The place is cute, has small tables, but I wouldn't recommend coming with more than 4 friends, it gets a bit cramped. The yogurt is self serve. I had a small cup of original tart with some dark brownie bits and strawberries. The yogurt was great, just the right amount of tartness and sweetness.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Very cute little shop. Self serve with natural ingredients and unique flavors like...chai. The staff is polite and will help you sample flavors. It's just too painful to shell out $.68/ounce for frozen yogurt. To give an example of what that could look like, the husband and I filled 2 small cups with froyo and toppings and the grand total was $12.60. At least there are 3 or 4 tables inside to hang out with friends and eat your natural and expensive yogurt. To each their own.
author: Lisa H.

description: Easy Breezy Frozen Yogurt is such a cute place to grab some froyo with your friends, significant other, or whoever! My best friend and I walked past Easy Breezy on a Sunday night and found the shop to be clean, bright, and very organized! You can choose from small, medium, and large cups to swirl your yogurt with their classic flavors such as french vanilla and tart to the more unique flavors such as lime and peanut butter. If you want to skip the cups, they have cones available on the far left near the sauces (caramel, hot fudge, marshmallow sauce etc) and they have plenty of toppings to choose from (oreos, mochi, cereals, organic fruits, organic granola) Don't forget to try the green sour gummy men! I seriously loved everything about Easy Breezy and would definitely come back to get some delicious froyo.
author: Joyce E.

description: Get the Vanilla Custard! Seriously, I'm normally a tart yogurt kinda guy, but the caramel is amazing! You will not regret it.
author: Ammar R.

description: The yogurt is very good but the price is too high. $25 for 3 moderately sized yogurts....will not be one of my regular spots.  Also, not sure I should have been charged sales tax for take out.
author: Amy C.

description: The idea is great, the custard was good, the prices were terrible and no one told me what to do!  It took us way to long to figure out the process and there was only one very busy shop girl who we couldn't get the attention of.  After figuring out the process (which was less than Easy Breezy) the price really wasn't easy to hear at all (as their are NO prices labeled clearly anywhere).  Needless to say the experience was totally not worth the price :( ... I think things could be changed to make the whole process more enjoyable.  I will pop in from time to time to see if things changed...Until then "Holy Gelato" on 9th between Judah and Irving is my go to for a sweet treat!
author: Gregarious B.

description: I am traveling here on business and I saw from my window on the train this cute yogurt place. I always like to check out yogurt shops in any city I am in. I was so pleasantly surprised it was here. I had no idea it was their first day. I love the high ceilings in wood theme. I love how the Vanilla Custard was labeled "Full Fat" since it wasn't really yogurt. I mixed that with the chocolate and a little bit of the Coffee Toffee. They have about 8 flavors and standard toppings to choose from and you can ask for them to give you sample cup before you buy. Everything is based on weight like most places. It's a tad small inside but I would venture to say they will do well in a great, cute, walkable neighborhood of Inner Sunset. People can get their yogurt and continue their walking around.
author: Anthony B.

description: They advertise having non-dairy but it doesn't taste like ice cream or yogurt- it's more of a soft-serve sorbet and it's pricey. Yogurt is not my thing so I can't talk about their main product. If you want a huge selection of non-dairy desserts, I'd suggest going around the corner to Holy Gelato on 9th near Judah where they have 12 homemade flavors (and excellent regular gelato too, so I'm told). Holy Gelato also offers cones in addition to bowls!
author: Mark H.

description:
With time this place is just getting better and better.  I've been back about half a dozen times (it's right in the neighborhood okay, that's my excuse).  I've never been disappointed.  They add new flavors almost weekly.  The staff continues to make you feel warm and welcome.  They've added toppings such as toasted coconut, mango, himalayan sea salt, waffle cone cookies, and (hipsters, prepare yourselves) BACON.

I also learned they use organic, locally farmed dairy and they don't add sugar to their yogurt!
author: Meg M.

description: I was so excited to have a fro-to place opening in the neighborhood. The fro-yo is super yummy, nice and creamy, but holy crap, there should be flakes of gold in it for the amount it costs. I filled my cup only half way and added a pump of carmel (no other toppings) and it was $7.32. I thought I heard her wrong. I wanted to put it back, but obviously that's not an option. The whole walk home I was convinced their scale must be wrong and was mad I didn't say anything. At any other fro-yo place this would have been $3-$4. Now looking at some of these reviews, I guess it really is that pricey. It will be a rare treat to go here, not a regular stop as I had assumed it would be when I saw it was opening. I'll be curious to see if it lasts at these prices.
author: Corrie F.

description: Stopped by here for dessert after dinner. The staff is super friendly and helpful (it's the kind of fro-yo place where the staff serves you the samples). They had about 8 flavors. Ended up getting the Pistachio made with almond milk, and the banana made with soy. I'm lactose intolerant so I was really pleasantly surprised to see these options. The pistachio wasn't great, since I think the almond milk flavor overpowered it, but the banana was pretty good. They're also really nice about their loyalty card thing =). Wouldn't mind coming back to see what flavors they got here!
author: Jefferson L.

description: I was going to give this place only 3-stars because the froyo itself wasn't that impressive and the layout of the toppings was confusing, but then I discovered that they had bacon bits as a topping so I irrationally upped it to 4.
author: Ian L.

description: Delicious fresh frozen yogurt. Locally owned plus they accept credit cards. Will return with my kids often!
author: Angela W.

description: I am addicted now... the only place I wanna go if I want to eat something sweet and cold. I love it! I love how you can put your own toppings on it.
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description: This place has a great, interesting assortment of flavors and toppings.  The yogurt flavors are good, though I'd strongly recommend doing samples before you buy a huge heap.  The yogurt itself isn't as thick as I'd like and melts a little fast, but honestly, it's the toppings that are top-notch.  They have a delicious cookie dough that's egg and dairy free and a chewy brownie.  Cute branding/logo and super friendly staff.  Also, the store itself is smalll, and it's very easy to get lines mixed up.
author: Lily N.

description: This is a really cute fro yo place in Inner Sunset. I've come here a lot, so I've had a lot of different flavors. They have a huge selection of quality toppings and sauces unlike other places that just have cereal. They are good about switching up flavors, with some I've never seen elsewhere (like Vietnamese coffee). Two thumbs up.
author: Lisa V.

description: The Inner Sunset is perfect now.  We have frozen yogurt!  This place is great, just like the Noe location.  Yummy flavors - tart to custard - very clean self-serve topping bar.  Happy to see this addition to the neighborhood.
author: Jill H.

description:
I love frozen yogurt. So much so that - living in the Inner Sunset - I would travel all across the city to satisfy my cravings. Now that I have Easy Breezy literally around the corner, my days of traveling far for frozen yogurt are gone!

Easy Breezy really has it all - delicious yogurt, high quality toppings, friendly staff and welcoming decor.  I love the rotating flavors, and can't wait to see which ones are next. 

For all of the comments about it being pricey - I'm not sure I agree. I just went with a group of friends and we all got normal sized portions with toppings for under $4. A totally reasonable price for a delicious snack! I would question the portion sizes of people who are complaining about the prices (For the record - the reviewer complained about paying $25 - at $0.61 per oz, that would be 40 oz of yogurt!)
author: Rachel J.

description: Ever since Tuttimelon closed down on Irving (heartbroken!), I've been on a search for a comparable frozen yogurt, well, besides Pinkberry which is also very good, but it's all the way in downtown.  I came across Easy Breezy after having lunch at Crepevine. I'd thought I'll give this place a try, won't hurt.  Their flavors are unique!  I tried the nutella and it was awesome!  The original tart flavor is my favorite. I love the way how they call out the fatness & tartness of each flavor. I've finally found a froyo go to place!!
author: Alyce l.

description: My favorite neighborhood frozen yogurt place! I love it and their flavors are awesome. Plus, punch cards are a huge bonus.
author: Kristen G.

description: I won't eat frozen yogurt anywhere else after having been here. The tart, Nutella, peanut butter, pistachio, banana cream pie, and everything in between is so delicious. You can't beat quality, organic ingredients. I'm so happy I live close by!
author: Danielle M.

description: Great addition to the inner sunset. They offer lots of frozen yogurt flavors and toppings from potato chips to fruit to candy and other delights. The specialty flavors rotate in and out, but they always have a tart and vanilla bean and some kind of chocolate. My only complaint is that the yogurt melts so quickly, so even if you take it to-go you have to eat on the street and go home and put it in the freezer for a bit. But otherwise, all around delicious!
author: Naomi H.

description: Oh the name sounds kinda weird and I was skeptical about going in but my friends insist.  Anyways, glad we did because I enjoyed my frozen yogurt from there.  Most of their toppings were filled except their strawberry, which is probably a popular topping.  I only had their original yogurt so I can not say for the other flavors but rumor has it the strawberry one was good too. It was not sour like some places and i love how they have mini mochis as topping! It helped with my sweet tooth craving.  Will most likely come again if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Ann L.

description: Really small place, but decent selection of flavors. Lots of dairy-free and low/nonfat options. Decent toppings bar.
author: Lauren F.

description: Peanut peanut butter! The sign caught my eye and I had to go in. Friendly employees, clean natural green shop.I love the tart, custard, chocolate but my favorite is peanut butter. Not into toppings so the center island is just in my way but the Toppings do look healthier than the competition. I cannot pass this place without going in in fact it is further from my house where I used to go to Tutilemon. There is no comparison EB wins on all levels. Not a fan of the chosen name but it's cool the product is awesome top-quality and the service friendly. This place attracts everyone from young families students all ages who appreciate and expect to consume non-GMO and organic.
author: Amy E.

description: The yogurt here is just ok..it's no Fraiche, and to be honest, even Pinkberry is better. The yogurt tastes kind of icy (not in a good way) even the full fat custard. I do like that they have organic yogurt and fruit toppings (and for you real celiacs, they label toppings that are gluten-free)
author: Taz M.

description:
This place is definitely worth the 49 or 59 cent an oz w.e the price is. Yogurt made fresh in the back every day. Wonderful staff that are not only  enthusiastic, but knowledgeable about their own product as well as kind & welcoming. The flavors are unique and the yogurt has a texture letting you know it's not just proccessed junk. 

I tried the nutella, banna cream, a couple others, and their chocolate salted turtles. They had to use the tart base that day, but it was all still delicious. Looking forward to going back and dropping them a couple bucks.
author: Mr. D.

description: I got the French vanilla custard swirled with lemon ginger zinger. So yummy! The place is really small and gets crowded but its worth it.
author: Honey A.

description:
so glad this place opened! now, i can get my froyo basically wherever i am along the sunset spectrum (inner/outer).

the decor of the place is really cute...like REALLY.

the employees (well...i only met one), but the employeE there was really nice. this isn't always the case. n it aint always easy to be so nice when you work in the service industry.

the yogurt!...they actually MAKE it...from scratch (i think...pretty sure.) yeah, that's what i understood. it tasted like it anyway.

(only thing that i wish was different was that it was slightly cheaper...it is a bit on the expensive side compared with other froyo spots)
author: G L.

description: i am a froyo fiend. i am hooked on pinkberry but easy breezy is equally as good..if not better. i've tried quite a few flavors but my favorites are pistachio and coconut cream pie (both are delicious and equally addicting). easy breezy has a variety of yummy toppings including fresh fruit, chocolate candies and mochi. my only gripe with this place is that it's pretty spendy...a small yogurt with one topping can easily cost you $9 bucks.
author: Jae C.

description:
I have been waiting for a frozen yogurt place to open in the Inner Sunset for so long! I was SO excited when I heard this place was opening and finally got to try it today. It is pretty good. They have a fairly good selection of yogurt and toppings. It looks like they always have vanilla, chocolate and tart flavors available, and they rotate in a couple of additional fun flavors. There were some toppings I like to get at other places that I didn't see, but there was still good variety. I like that it is high quality and that it is family owned. I have to agree that it is way too expensive though. It's 61 cents per ounce. For comparison, my favorite fro yo place in the city is 43 cents per ounce. They have a much larger selection of toppings and flavors, it's also high quality, and it's on Union Street which I would actually expect to be priced higher than the Inner Sunset. That makes Easy Breezy almost 50% more expensive, which is kind of crazy I think.

I am still happy that we have a frozen yogurt place now, but a little bummed that we still don't have one to replace my other favorites in the city. Will I go back? Yes, every once in a while. It is convenient and yummy. But I definitely won't be visiting as much as I would have otherwise. I'll get my fro yo fix while I'm out and about instead of saving it for when I'm back home. My guess is that this pricing works for their Noe Valley location. I think they'd do more business in our neighborhood if they lowered their price a bit to be more competitive/realistic with what people are used to paying. But I guess we'll see!

Bottom line: you'll enjoy it! Just be careful when you're filling your cup because it will add up quickly.
author: Amanda M.

description: Any froyo joint that offers Twix on their toppings bar is legit in my book. They have about a half dozen or so froyo flavors on tap at any given time; personally, I love the taro and the vanilla. All of their toppings are strong (mini M&Ms, fresh fruits) to quite strong (Twix, cookie dough), with the exception of their "boba" pearls (they're more exploding pockets of artificial fruit flavor than tapioca balls).
author: Matt T.

description: Easy Breezy rocks my world!  They make non-dairy frozen yogurt and always have new, delicious flavors!  The staff is always really friendly and it's just a couple blocks away!  Great place to take a study break and get a sugar high!
author: Audrey K.

description: Eh, normal froyo but over priced.. And the flavors are weird.. Chili? Chai tea? Nice decor tho
author: Droolie Y.

description: Great variety of yogurts, constantly changing.  Clean but I never was a fan of the salad bar set-up...too many kid's greasy fingers within reach...(*full disclosure - I'm a little OCD about that stuff ..:P ).   GREAT servers, at least when I was there.  Free samples and friendly.  I hope they get paid well.  I didn't see too many people even looking at the tip jar.  I guess you can tell I am also in a business that relies heavily on tips.  We service employees are the best tippers!  I'm thinking nowadays, though, with all the seemingly well-heeled, young tightwads in SF, we might be the ONLY tippers.  With EZ Breezy being a bit pricey for me (taxi driver) I won't be stopping by everyday... but when I do, I'll get the yogurt with the highest fat content and enjoy every dangerous spoonful.... And I'll tip those kids!!!  (hey, how do I add pics on this contraption?)
author: Randy O.

description:
This is by far the best fro to I've ever had. And I've had a lot of fro yo. In each flavor that I tried, you can taste the real foods that went into it like black berry, bananas, custard, etc. It doesn't seem artificial at all. They have great toppings too, like bacon, potato chips, popping bobas, lucky charms (I think that's what it was at least). I got custard/blackberry swirl and banana cream pie yogurt, with bacon, potato chips, and boba topping. So good!

But the best part of it is the atmosphere of the place. If the atmosphere wasn't up to par with the yogurt, it would have been a four star review. The guy who works there (seems like he is the founder too but idk) was standing outside passing out samples. I got a blackberry sample and I just sort of had to buy some of this incredible fro yo. When you walk in the shop it feels like you are walking into a bunch if different eras, yet it's different from anything I've ever seen. The music choice is fun, the guy working there seems to be having fun too, and the decor is beyond awesome. If you're looking for a frozen yogurt place in the sunset district of SF this is the place :)
author: Laura H.

description: This place is really cool especially because the owners really listen to their customers and make improvements. I had commented before about the layout and they actually changed it and its much better! I also liked the flavors better the last time I went. Its great that they mix it up. I feel bad saying this, but I really haven't tried anything that has really impressed me. I feel like even Yogurtland and Pinkberry pack more flavor in every bite than here. I really want them to do well, I love their branding and everything. I just feel like they need to take their flavors to the next level.
author: Dexter H.

description: Every single non-dairy flavor is literally heaven on earth, and they have the cutest froyo dispensing machine thing ever made (it's a house!).
author: Vincent Y.

description: Good stuff - especially on a warm day.  The vanilla custard is everything people say it is.  I added even more calories with a lump of COOKIE DOUGH - that's what I'm talking about ...
author: Jaina S.

description:
This place fills a much needed hole in what's available in the Inner Sunset neighborhood! Unfortunately, they have a little bit of work ahead of them before I can bump up their rating. The price per ounce is a tad more expensive than other froyo places, though I imagine the rent can't be cheap so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt. They did slightly lower their prices over the past couple of weeks so definitely good steps. Their froyo flavors - from what I tried - are really good! And they have a good number of machines! But, and this was my biggest issue, a lot of the times I stop by, some of the machines are out of order! I think the best part of froyo is the number of options of yogurt flavors and toppings you get, but when I came by last time, with MOST of the machines being broken and only three flavors available - it just killed my desire for froyo. I actually walked out disappointed and went somewhere else for dessert instead. Another time I stopped by, some of the toppings were a little stale.

When it's in tiptop shape, this is a great place to check out. When it's not, it leaves a lot to be desired. 

Otherwise, don't forget that they have tasting cups by the cashier. You just have to ask!
author: Lena Y.

description: Love love love this froyo spot!!! They have great and unique toppings (bacon, potato chips, toasted coconut, Lego shaped candies just to name a few) and a pretty good selection of both regular and different yogurt flavors. The employees are super nice and helpful, the girl even made a sample of a Girl Scout Samoa Cookie concoction she had recently invented. (Chocolate yogurt, toasted coconut and caramel sauce. Yum.) if you don't go overboard with the amount you get, you'll avoid sticker shock when you check out. Great addition to the inner sunset, I'm so glad they opened another spot a little closer to my house!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Super yummy yogurt! I tried the strawberry, vanilla custard, peanut butter, and chocolate (my favorites listed in that order) everything tasted very fresh. Although it was a bit pricy compared to the other self serve yogurt (about 50 cents/ oz) totally worth it though!! A cute little shop that all should check out
author: Kayla K.

description: Delicious yogurt and wide selection of rotating flavors. Clean and new atmosphere. Reasonably priced and solid staff! My fav so far has been the chocolate dipped banana with almond milk.
author: Julia W.

description:
This is the best yogurt I have ever eaten. I go more often than I probably should but the yogurt tastes real and unlike most, actually tastes like the flavor it claims to be. 

Custard is my favorite but every flavor proves to be great and the shop is a very nice place to sit and enjoy your yogurt.
author: Lauren H.

description: So excited they had peanut butter soft serve made with almond milk! Lactose is no friend of mine and sorbet gets boring. I will be back for more pb sundaes!
author: christine c.

description:
This cute, local organic yogurt shop caught my eye when I was walking past with my mother. 

When we walked in, the owner was serving samples. You asked what you want to sample, and he'll hand it to you in a mini paper cup. When you decide what you want, you grab a cup and serve yourself.

The flavors were great -- and the owner said that he makes each flavor himself! When I was there, the flavors included milk chocolate (delicious), original tart, peanut butter, lemon, custard, vanilla, pistachio, and chocolate chili (DELICIOUS - yes, really!)

Oh, I also got a punch card. If I buy 10 yogurts, I get one free. Which is awesome because I'll be back!
author: Ellie M.

description: When I first came here I thought I was going in to your average cookie cutter yogurt shop. I didn't have many expectations. I have to say though, they may have the best frozen yogurt in the city. The cashew flavor is deadly. I'm on a fairly strict diet and I have trouble not indulging. The workers here are very cool and willing to give you as many samples as you want. Place is a little small inside, so on some nights it can get crowded but it's worth it!
author: Al S.

description: Would give five stars but not all their flavors are appealing to me. Although I do applaud them for their great consistency, texture and quality of frozen yogurt. Once I dropped by and got a cup that was Vietnamese coffee flavored. Viet coffee is unlike american, its very distinct and I enjoyed it. Most of the frozen yogurt are great tasting and strong. My favorite place. Love
author: Natalie Charlotte W.

description: This place is brand new, but already amazing! Everything is made fresh by Han everyday. You have to try the banana!
author: Nick T.

description: Came here on a friend's raving recommendation. The place has impressive decor and feels very family friendly. Staff provides service with a genuine smile and even helps with samples. I sampled the key lime pie and blueberry, and both were packed with flavor. I believe they change their flavors weekly. I will definitely return to this local froyo place.
author: Gary H.

description: Don't agree with those who say it is overpriced! It's priced very reasonably considering the quality and variety (I love almond milk based options). Staff is friendly. Love it.
author: Rom M.

description: Frozen yogurt is really high end and so are the toppings. The frozen custard with waffle come cookies and chocolate turtles is amazing! We knew it was going to be expensive based on the reviews so we weren't surprised when it was $15 for two. I don't know what is crazier...we paid $15 for two cups of frozen yogurt or that we went back 3 days later for more!
author: Ben S.

description: We had the frozen custard which was good but the pace is fairly pricey compared to Nubi for instance.
author: Roman I.

description: Stopped by on Saturday due to the warm weather. Yogurt was good - great topping selection.  Very expensive. I got two small (filled half the small cup with yogurt) yogurts with very light toppings and it cost me $9. Ouch.
author: Stacey O.

description: I'm vegan and had a mix of the chai and Vietnamese coffee frozen yogurts and they were very refreshing and yummy, and not too sweet. Would definitely go back for a treat and to try new flavors! I haven't tried the gelato at holy gelato so I can't compare.
author: K B.

description: Best frozen yogurt I've ever had! Dangerous to live so close by. Great variety and rotation of flavors and toppings.

author: Sally S.

description:
2nd time here & doesn't disappoint.  58¢ per oz. is a bit expensive, but for being a SF-only shop, and their yogurt is creamy & organic, I'd say it's a pretty fair price.  They have their regular flavors (ex: vanilla custard, vanilla bean, original tart, etc), then they have flavors they change EVERY Monday.  My first time I had their Mango Lassi & Original Tart.  Original Tart....not much to say only that it's tart.  Mango Lassi tasted familiar, exactly like the Kasugai Japanese gummy candy.  THIS time: sampled almost all their new flavors and the one I found most unique: Mint Mojito.  I enjoyed the light, refreshing taste of actual fresh mint.  Not overpowering whatsoever.  It's unique in that they're the first to add real mint leaves to yogurt.  This flavor definitely should be enjoyed alone and on an empty palette.  The light mint flavors really come out nicely. Taro...a bit too sweet, but that's because I prefer taro soft, savory, and made Chinese-style.

After sampling the new flavors, I decided on one new flavor, one "regular" flavor: peanut butter & vanilla bean.  One of the workers said she had been working hard to mix the peanut butter into the yogurt so I gave it a try.  Perhaps I, next time, will do a different mix. Peanut butter, being peanut butter, overpowered the vanilla bean, and therefore, causing vanilla bean to seem flavorless.  All I tasted was peanut butter & "bland" yogurt.  Don't get me wrong, vanilla is typically light in flavor so blending a strong flavor and very light flavors of course the stronger of the 2 shall win.
They have a nice variety of toppings, of which mochi & strawberry are my go-to.  I noticed they have bacon, but will try this on another day.

Ok, long review but please bear with me.  Shop doesn't have a lot of seating, but it is cozy & clean; the wall color & awning are cute & inviting.  There are benches outside to enjoy your fro-yo and chill.  I love that this shop is located ONLY in SF.  2 locations: one on Irving & one on Castro (in the Noe Valley district).  I hope this stays only in SF.  My question is if a changing flavor becomes popular,  will they repeat their weekly-changing flavor?
author: Jessica S.

description: Yummy! Great for sweet tooths trying to watch their weight. I had their low-fat chocolate milk flavored yogurt, piled up with wonderful toppings. For example, sensational caramel chocolate turtle chunks. Amazing.
author: Emily H.

description: I'm lactose intolerant so I was very happy that they had dairy free options!!!! The last time I was there I got snickerdoodle and it was SO GOOD. My friends got it too and they said it was their favorite even though they tried the mango flavor, regular tart, and nutella. Can't go wrong with the other flavors either and I love that it's always changing!
author: Gina N.

description: This place is awesome! Just tried the chocolate milkshake and vanilla bean flavors. They have a bunch of different toppings but I didn't get any this time. I'll definitely be back, though. The owner (or who I think is the owner.. lol) is super friendly.
author: Melissa C.

description: What can I say? Truly truly amazing. This is place is truly, truly... outrageous... Flavors? Amazing. Cost? Nothing. Service? Amazing. I'm not sure if its his name, but one male worker who looks like Robert DeNiro works there, greets me with "Hello, welcome to Easy Breezy", and I feel happy inside. I believe his name is Romolo, and he is fantastic. If you want to be treated like a king, go to this place and talk with Romolo, he'll give you a good time. BEST PLACE I HAVE EVER BEEN TO IN MY LIFE HANDS DOWN, BETTER THAN COITIS AND BETTER THAN LOVE.
